loans.use: To purchase women's clothing

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: B. Sarah is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a business lady who runs a retail shop as her business, as well as keeping goats and sheep for a living. She is quick to confirm that her previous loans have helped her to expand her shop; increase the number of animals that she keeps, and have also enabled her to buy a plot of land on which she plans to build houses to rent. Sarah needs a loan to help her buy more of her shop products like sugar, muffins, soap, cooking oil and many other things for resale.

loans.use: Buying more stock for her retail shop.

loans.name: Ramy

texts.en: Ramy is a 28-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2007 he decided to begin a new career and opened his own business, an electronic repair shop. Today, Ramy is applying for a loan of in the amount of 1,200 to buy more equipment for his business.

loans.use: To buy equipment.

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en:
Mariza P. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 33 years old and married with an infant.  To make a living, Mariza sells both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

Mariza joined HSPFI earlier this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mariza successfully repaid a previous HSPFI loan of 7000 PHP, which was used to purchase new items and expand her product offering.  Mariza is now requesting her third loan, this one for 10000 PHP, for the same purpose.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand her product offering.

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en:
K. Bashorat is married and has three children. She runs a small business selling rice in the local market. Her place is located on the main market aisle where there are many customers every day. Bashorat has been in this business for over 8 years. She is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. Her professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of her business. Bashorat is requesting a loan for $800 to increase the assortment of her selling inventory. She is hoping that this loan will help her venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Bashorat's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow her to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale.

loans.name: Mrs. Nary Khin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of nineteen people, is located in Svay Prey village in Kandal province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Nary K. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare (5-acre) field on which she cultivates rice. On this plantation, she faces a problE. because her field has infertile soil which it is bad enough to affect her crop production. In order to solve this problE., she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make the crop more productive.

Mrs. Nary K. is 38 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Theng Khan, is a construction foreman.

Nine members in this group loans have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden R. is from the village of Benoni, Camiguin. She is 35 years old and married with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Eden sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Eden has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Eden joined HSPFI earlier this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eden has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Eden is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Eden from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to continue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand her product offering.

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en:
Munavvar K. is 29 years old and married to Suhrob who is a doctor. They live in their own house with the basic necessities. They have two children. Munavvar has been the owner of a small general store for more than 3 years. She sells foodstuff for every day use such as flour, macaroni, soft drinks, sweets, etc. Munavvar runs her business from her home and her children help her.  She is requesting a loan is to purchase more merchandise to stock the business. A larger selection of goods will attract more clients and generate a good monthly income to help her family. Please help strong and courageous Munavvar to keep working!

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en: Afaf is a 36 year-old married woman living with her husband and 3 young children. She opened her own beauty shop in 2001 where she sells make-up and beauty products to the neighboring villages. Today, Afaf is requesting to borrow $1,200 to expand her business and purchase merchandise.

loans.use: To expand her business and purchase merchandise

loans.name: Dilshodi

texts.en:
Dilshod is 19 years old. He is a young boy with a great desire to get ahead in life. Dilshod has been running a pharmacy business for two years. He started this business after graduating medical college. Dilshod loves his work. He likes to help people and is ready to consult the patients purchasing the medicines in his store and those who could not find the required goods in his store. For the years of his work Dilshod was dreaming to open his own drug store and saving money for this. He hopes that someday he can realize his dream. Now Dilshod requests $ 500 US Dollars for purchasing more medicines. He promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks everyone supporting him.

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 27 year old Tumaini M. from Mbozi. She is married with one  child, of 9.. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependants because they are orphans. Tumaini has been running a shop since 2007. She owns a small duka or neighborhood shop in the city where she sells common household and grocery items.
She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Tumaini currently earns about 100USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase shop items in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve quality and range of product. Tumaini thanks you for your support!

loans.name: Abdurozim

texts.en:
H. Abdurozim is an ordinary man in Rudaki region of Tajikistan. He is a very responsible person who, since his youth, has been running a livestock farm with the goal of supporting his family, his wife and two children. Abdurozim needs to purchase calves and goats to reproduce them and maximize his profits by selling their milk and meat.

Once he has these products from his flock he sells them in his neighborhood and in this manner he is able to support his family. For this reason, Abdurozim is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business. loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en:
H. Murodjon is a very courageous man that is characterized as someone who can manage tough jobs like raising cattle and agriculture. He's the father of 3 children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation and after much time he has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of cattle to breed them on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Murodjon comes to IMON International for loans for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en:
K. Farrukh is 22 years old. He is not married yet. In order to support his parents with family expenses, Farrukh is running his own business. He has a butcher shop and has been running a meat-selling business for 4 years. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food.

Now Farrukh is requesting a loan of $750 USD. Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro entrepreneur and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan. Farrukh is counting on your help. Your support will really help him. loans.use: To buy meat to expand his business.

loans.name: Nasir

texts.en:
T. Nasir is 58 years old. He is married and has one independent son. Nasir has had a trying life but he keeps an optimistic outlook. He remains a strong and persevering person, intent on improving his family’s standard of living. Nasir sells fuel near his house, both gasoline and diesel. His twelve years of selling fuel have given him the experience to do his work successfully, and he has clients who always come to him. Today Nasir is requesting a loan of $1600 that will be used to increase his fuel supply in order to meet his clients' demands. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of Nasir’s business and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Increase his fuel supply

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 50-year-old single man living with his brother. He owns three rental homes which provide enough income to improve the lives of his brother and himself. Today, Mohamad wants to borrow $500 for repairs and maintenance on a rental home.

loans.use: Maintenance for a rental home

loans.name: Urinbiy

texts.en:
Since she was very young, Urinbiy has been in touch with the countryside. Her family dedicated themselves to cultivating fruits and vegetables. As a youngster, she imagined she’d be in the business of selling produce, and fortunately she has realized this dream. At the age of 16, she began to sell vegetables in small markets. Little by little, she was saving money so she could set up her own shop. Thanks to her efforts and the love she has for her work, Urinbiy’s business has been gradually growing. Urinbiy believes it is time now to inject more capital into the business so that she can buy at wholesale prices and make a higher profit. She is requesting a loan of $800 to increase the range of vegetables that she sells. With your help Urinbiy will be able to move her business forward.

loans.use: To increase the range of vegetables she sells

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 34-year-old married man with two children. He has owned an espresso machine since 2006. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs. Today, Mohamad is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy more merchandise to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en:
I. Bashorat is 48 years old. She’s married with two children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 20 years she is purchasing the young cattle and calves in the local market, fattens and sells them. Bashorat is a very hard-working woman and her diligence is incredible. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration. She has always looked for a way to be an important protagonist by providing extra income to her home. Bashorat wakes up early every morning to feed her cows and bulls, with the goal of fattening them and selling them at the best price in the local market. Her husband (pictured) actively helps her with operations. Thanks to this activity she is supporting her children with education. Bashorat wants to keep educating them because she hopes that they’ll reach the goals that they have laid out for themselves. With this purpose she is requesting a loan of $ 800 USD to buy calves in order to expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live.

loans.use: Purchasing the small cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
M. Alisher is 25 years old. He is married with three small children. Alisher has a restaurant where he sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. Prior to opening his own business, he worked at a restaurant where he learned the ins and outs of the trade. When Alisher first started his business he only opened to sell breakfast because he worked at night. Once his place became more popular he was able to dedicate his whole time to the business. Alisher wants the loan so he may invest in foodstuff to expand his business. He is asking for $1000 USD. With this money, Alisher will be able to expand his business and to earn more. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Contribute to the growth of his business and they will be grateful.

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuff for expanding his business.

loans.name: Farrukhdjon

texts.en:
T. Farrukhdjon has a small business capitalizing on the huge demand in Tajikistan for cell phones and related accessories. He started selling phones a year ago and now has a small stand in a market. He is not married yet but despite his young age he supports his parents. Farrukhdjon’s business is very personal. Often he will get a request for a specific phone or accessory and he will make a special effort to find it if he does not have it in stock. At the same time Farrukhdjon provides the service of repairing cell phones. Farrukhdjon has requested a loan to give him extra capital to purchase an instrument that is required for the diagnostics of cell phones. IMON International is happy to be able to provide the means for Farrukhdjon to strengthen his business and continue working toward his goals.

loans.use: To purchase an instrument required for the diagnostics of cell phones

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 32-year-old married man living with his wife and three children. He has been working as a carpenter since 2006 to earn income to satisfy the needs of his family. Today, Ali is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy tools to develop his work.

loans.use: buy tools

loans.name: Abduhamid

texts.en:
Abduhamid is a responsible father. From the time he was a young, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Abduhamid hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

loans.use: Purchasing the cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.en:
Y. Abdumalik is a 54-year-old married man who lives with his wife and four children. He has thirty-two years of experience in raising cattle. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Abdumalik has become a very successful businessman. Abdumalik has a close-knit family that tries to help each other, so his wife and elder son help him in the business. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning them, feeding and pasturing. Now Abdumalik wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. He applied for a loan of $600. With your help Abdumalik can get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 32-year-old married woman and mother of 4 children. She has been working as a home-based tailor since 2007 to help her husband in the household. Today, Fatmeh is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy additional textiles so she can satisfy the heavy demands of the market and help increase her income.

loans.use: buy additional textiles

loans.name: Stanely's Group

texts.en: M. Stanely is the leader of his lending group in Bushenyi. He is a married man with 4 children aged 18 – 6 years, as he cares for 1 orphan. He is a business man with a retail shop that sells general merchandise in Kabusaho trading centre for 9 years which he transformed from selling yellow bananas. His main challenge is transporting his products from the main town to the village where his shop is making him earn 200,000/= as profits a month. Stanely has a dream of shifting his shop to Bushenyi main town where he will be able to make more sales and more money as a result. He also wants to see all his children educated to the University level by increasing his profitability. He needs a loan to be able to buy more stock for increased turn over. He is really a hard working man.

loans.use: Buying more retail stock for increased profitability.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a 26-year-old divorced woman living with her parents. She has been working as a hairdresser since 2001, servicing neighboring villages. Today, Rita is wanting to borrow $1,200 to buy tools and a vapor machine to satisfy the demands of her clients.

loans.use: To buy tools and a vapor machine

loans.name: Jovlet's Group

texts.en: R. Jovlet is a 27 year old female and married with 2 children aged 8 years and 6 months. She helps to take care of 3 orphans plus paying their school fees and general upkeep. She has a supermarket business of 6 years in Nyakabirizi that she started as a retail shop and her main challenge is the credit management of her clients. Although her business is in a rural area, Jovlet is able to make 70,000/= as profits a week and these contribute to the well being of her family. She has a dream of opening up another outlet as a wholesale shop so that she can have double income. Jovlet strongly believes that she will be able to educate all her children to the University by being able to pay their school dues. She needs a loan to be able to increase stock in her supermarket so as to supply to her customers’ needs and wants better.

loans.use: Restocking her supermarket with more goods.

loans.name: Zayno

texts.en: Zayno is a 26-year-old single man. He has been working as a DJ since 2003. Today, Zayno is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy a specific machine for his work which will satisfy the needs of the market and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy a specific machine for his work

loans.name: Rawad

texts.en: Rawad is a 23-year-old married man living with his parents. He has owned a flower shop since 2004 with a previous 8 years of experience. In order to develop his work, Rawad is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase additional preparation tools.

loans.use: purchase additional preparation tools

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en: Grace A. is the leader of her lending group in Bushenyi. She is 41 years old and married with four children between the ages of 7 and 18, all of whom are in school. Grace has had a business of selling fruits and vegetables in the Bushenyi daily market for sixteen years. She started selling only the quantity that she grew from her own garden, but now she also buys from her fellow farmers, because she has the capital from her own savings and with the help of loans.  As a result, she is able to make $15 a week in profits.  Her dream is to start supplying her produce to companies, supermarkets and hotels in Bushenyi. This is Grace’s 18th loan with Pearl Microfinance and she is grateful for the achievements she has made through this partnership.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for increased profit.

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en: Nadine is a 28-year-old married woman. She has been working in embroidery /needlework and in the artisanal sector since 2004 to help her husband in the household. Today, Nadine is asking to borrow $500 to buy merchandise so that she can participate in a summer symposium to present her hand-made collection.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Jouman

texts.en: Joumana is a 45-year-old married woman and mother of 2 children. She has been working as a tailor since 1988. Over the years, thanks to her business income, she has been able to meet his children's needs in collaboration with her husband. Today, Joumana is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a new sewing machine to develop her work.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: faire un stock de céréales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fertilizer and soil amendments

loans.name: Agrina

texts.en:
Agrina is a  member of the  Gangulanga  borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa, She is 30 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 1 year old.

Agrina  has owned a  clothing business selling clothes for 2 years, she works 8 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is  Agrina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more kanga, vitenge (Fabric) for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Agrina hopes to save money  and expand her business.

loans.use: Tobuy more kanga nad vitenge for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acquire inventory of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: repair the working place

loans.name: Rozi

texts.en:
Rozi is a member of the Idope West borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is 40 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 15, 8, 2 years old woman. 

Rozi has owned a food business selling local beer for 2 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Rozi`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more Maize for making local beer.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Rozi hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for loacal beer

loans.name: Seimkan's Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group, Seimkan, is fifty-five years old. Her family consists of her husband, her 31-year-old son and herself. Seimkan is a school principal and sells milk, fifty liters a day. Her husband works as the deputy head of the local municipality, while her son is married and works at a police station. Seimkan and her husband used to live with his family and subsequently inherited some dairy cows. Through this inheritance she developed her dairy business, which brings in $90-95 every month.

Raising cows has been a tremendous extra source of income, enabling them to build a house of temporary construction in the village, buy a couch and armchairs and some other items for the home. Even though her son helps her deal with the cows, Seimkan would like to hire someone additional to look after the herd.

Seimkan is requesting a loan to purchase two year-old calves to fatten and some younger calves for breeding. Her ultimate goal is to have more cows than she has at the moment.

Seimkan’s partners are Nurlan, Nasipa and Kenjegul. Nurlan, 27, is married and is the cake production foreman at a confectionary plant. His wife works at a café, and on weekends his parents look after Nurlan’s cattle and farm. He is requesting a loan to buy two calves to fatten and resell.

Nasipa, 47, is the mother of six children, five of whom are married and on their own. Her youngest child, a sixteen-year-old son, goes to school and lives with his parents. Her husband operates a telephone company. Nasipa sells milk and works as the head of curriculum at school. Nasipa is requesting a loan to buy a calf.

Kenjegul, 55, is married. Her husband is retired and occupies himself with animal husbandry. They have raised four children, some of whom live separately, while some are still dependent. Kenjegul is requesting a loan to buy a milk cow for breeding.

About Mol Bulak Finance:

Mol Bulak Finance [Kyrgyzstan] This loan is being presented to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of its “3-Ps” concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow larger) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy two year-old calves for fattening & some younger calves for breeding and resale

loans.name: Levi's Group

texts.en:
M. Levi (see inset photo) is the leader of a lending group in Ibanda, a district in West Uganda, and is also a pastor spreading the word of God. He is 38 years old and married with four children, all in primary school. Levi has owned a retail shop for ten years in Kashare and works with his wife to ensure that there is business continuity. He makes 80,000 UGX in weekly profits due to his transparent business transactions. 

Levi needs a loan to be able to buy more stock for his shop to avoid shortages. His goal is to expand his retail shop as well as to have a happy and educated family.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his retail shop

loans.name: Ameth

texts.en:
Ameth is  a member of the Ganglonga borrower group in Kinayanambo, Iringa. She is 38 Year old woman. She is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children  are 14 and 3  years old.

Ameth has owned a Grocery  business for 3 years, She works 10 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Ameth`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more Drinks like beer, sods.

With the  additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Ameth hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more Drinks

loans.name: Azykbubu's Group

texts.en:
Azykbubu is the leader of this group. She enjoys her life being a farmer’s wife and has raised three children. Now she is 56 years old, and her eldest son and daughter are both married and live on their own. Only her twenty-year-old daughter, a college student, lives with them. Apart from farming and growing various things in the field, among all the pleasures of life in a rural area there is one that rewards her financially: selling milk. Azykbubu’s daily milk sales constitute around ten liters, which earns her about $55 a month.

No matter how “imperceptible” the gift looks, Azykbubu still remembers with delight and gratitude the day when her parents–in-law gave her one cow and three sheep as a present. Since that day she and her husband have been breeding cows. The profits from this venture have allowed them to buy tractors, provide for their children’s education and increase their herd.

Now, Azykbubu needs a loan to buy another cow. This would help her increase the size of her herd and the amount of milk she could sell. Azykbubu’s main goals are to give her daughter an education, marry her off and increase the population of her herd.

Azykbubu has three partners: Satybek, Kaldykul and Burulcha.

Satybek, 52, is married. He has a twenty–year-old daughter. To make a living he is engaged in cattle breeding. His wife works as a charwoman at the school. Satybek needs a loan to buy a calf for breeding.

Kaldykul, 52, has three children. Her husband is a shepherd, whereas she farms and sells milk. She grows barley, wheat and potatoes. Kaldykul’s married son lives with his parents. Her daughter-in-law often helps her care for the cows. Kaldykul hopes to get a loan and buy two calves.

Burulcha, 49, is divorced and has one daughter. Even though she has had a hard time providing for her daughter, Burulcha has enough steadfastness and dignity to continue struggling to live. She sells milk and grows potatoes. Burulcha needs a loan to buy ten sheep for breeding.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of its “3-Ps” concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow larger) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a cow to increase her milk sales

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a  member of the Idope borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa, She is 36 year old woman,  she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 11, and 2 years old.

Eva has owned a business selling sugarcane,onions, for 2 years, she works 8 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Eva`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more sugar cane, onions for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Eva hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more  sugar cane, onions

loans.name: Budi Lestari Group

texts.en:
Ni Made karti is a 37 year-old female living in the town of Katulampo - Manistutu.  Ni Made karti is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by DINARI.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Budi Lestari (DNR.M-0593).


Ni Made karti is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To make a living, Ni Made karti owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs to sell.  Ni Made karti has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 250,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2008, Ni Made karti joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Made karti is requesting for the first time a loan from DINARI.  She is  requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI.  Ni Made karti plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni Made karti - (-) merupakan 37 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Katulampo - Manistutu.  Ni Made karti adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Budi Lestari (DNR.M-0593).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Made karti sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Made karti menghasilkan sekitar 0,250 IDR.  Dalam 2008, Ni Made karti bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Made karti telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.000.000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.


*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Evalisto's Group

texts.en: T. Evalisto is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is 34 years old and married with 4 children and all are in school as he cares for 1 orphan. Evalisto is a boda boda rider in Kazo trading centre stage for 8 years and he is happy that he is able to make money that helps to run his home. When he started getting loans, he had was working from the village where there are few inexpensive customers but with the loans, he was able to secure and pay for a place in town where he is working from at the moment and over time, he has been able to use his loans to repair his motorcycle. He needs a loan to be able to pay his children’s school fees and partly employ labor on his farm for increased output.

loans.use: Paying his children's school fees and employing manpower on his farm.

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en: M. Jackline is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is a friendly and trustworthy lady with a business of selling produce, mostly matooke and Irish potatoes from the Kazo trading centre in Ibanda. She has a large banana plantation where she gets most of her produce to sell but also buys from other farmers when the season is poor, like with the Irish potatoes. She is married with 3 children and works very hard to ensure that their school fees are paid on time. She needs a loan to be able to buy more matooke to sell since the last season was not a favorable one for her. She also wants to partially pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more matooke (banana produce) to sell and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera is married with one child. She sells children's shoes at two locations - an open market and a small store where she rents space. Vera has been in this business for 10 years. A large assortment and low prices help Vera attract new and retain old clients. Children's shoes are always in high demand giving Vera the opportunity to develop her business further. Vera would like to borrow 17,000 UAH to purchase new inventory for the fall. Vera's goal is to make enough money to take care of her family.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr: L. Catherine est née le 24/03/1977 à Cotonou. Catherine est célibataire avec deux enfants tous scolarisés. Catherine habite Agla un quartier de Cotonou. Catherine a commencé le petit commerce il ya environ sept ans, après avoir abandonnée les études en classes de seconde. Catherine vendit  des fruits, puis de la nourriture, ensuite des gâteaux. Actuellement, Catherine vend des  divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.)et fait parallèlement  la distribution des vivres (farine de manioc, haricot, maïs, huile rouge de noix de palme). Catherine a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de la part d’ALIDé. Catherine a bien remboursé ce prêt et sollicite aujourd’hui un second pour augmenter le volume de son activité, son revenu et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
L. Catherine was born on March 24, 1977 in Cotonou. She is unmarried and has two children, both in school. She lives in Agla, a district of Cotonou. Catherine started a small business about seven years ago after having dropped out of school in the 10th grade. She sold fruit, then food, and then cakes. Currently, she sells a variety of items: candy, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, batteries, candles, etc. At the same time, she distributes staple foods (cassava flour, beans, corn, red oil from palm nuts). Catherine has already benefited from a loan from ALIDé and has repaid it. Today, she’s requesting a second one to increase her business volume and revenues and to satisfy her customers further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods (pasta, sugar, canned tomatoes, soaps, toilet paper, batteries, etc.) and staples (sacks of corn, beans, and cassava flour, and containers of oil)

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two children. She sells hardware and construction materials in a small store and has been in this business for five years. It is a family business and her husband is involved in it too. Olga decided to start this business because her family lacked money and today she makes enough to take care of the household.

Olga would like to borrow 17,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. Increased sales will help Olga to receive more profit and take better care of her family.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Princess

texts.en: Princess K. A. is 63 years old and she is a widow with four children. She sells provisions like cartons of milk and drinks and this is her main source of income. She hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Jérémie 3,16 Plus Group

texts.fr:
Eugénie M. 34 ans, est dirigeante de la Banque Communautaire dénommée « Jérémie Plus 3 :16 ». Elle est constituée de 37 membres unis solidairement pour recevoir les prets de Kiva dans le but de développer leurs activités.
Eugénie est depuis 1999 dans le monde de micro-entreprise. Elle vend des beignets, l’eau pure ainsi que des boissons. Son activité est entrain de se développer progressivement. Le prêt qu’elle obtiendra prochainement lui servira d’acheter la farine de froment, l’huile végétale et la boisson à revendre dans le but d’augmenter le bénéfice. Son affaire génère un bénéfice de $60 par semaine. Eugénie a une ambition d’élargir son activité en ajoutant d’autres produits. La qualité des ses beignets ainsi que le maintien de bonnes relations avec ses clients garantissent la clientèle de son affaire
texts.en:
Eugénie M., aged 34, is the manager of the Banque Communautaire named “Jérémie Plus 3 :16”. It is composed of 37 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses. Eugénie has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1999. She sells beignets (fritters or doughnuts) and pure water, as well as drinks. Her business is in the middle of developing progressively. The loan she’ll obtain next will be used to buy wheat flour, vegetable oil, and drinks to sell retail with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $60 per week. Eugénie has the ambition of expanding her business by adding other products. The quality of her beignets, as well as the upkeep of good relations with her customers, guarantees customers for her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, vegetable oil, and drinks to sell retail to increase her profits

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en: Sultan M. B. is a Tanzanian an entrepreneur business married man. He runs a business of a fruits shop. He sells varieties of fruits at Mji Mwema Ward at Kigamboni in Dar es Salaam including: Paw paws, Bananas, Oranges, Mangoes and Avocados. She also sells green vegetables. He purchases the business goods direct from the producers in whole sales and some times purchased from the city market and selling in retail to consumer customers. Business income helps him to meet his daily family demand and paying children school fees. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to purchase more business goods

loans.use: To buy more business goods

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy L. is a married woman and a Tanzanian small-business entrepreneur. She runs a shop selling traditional clothes at Kigamboni, Dar es Salaam. She sells khanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print) and batik (cotton cloth dyed after brushing on hot liquid wax to protect desired areas). These types of clothes are highly used by Tanzanian women and the East African women as a whole.

Teddy purchases the business goods wholesale from the Mnazi Mmoja traditional city market center in and sells to her customers. She has been in the business for four years and the business income enables her to meet her daily needs and those of the family.

Teddy is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Mutiyat

texts.en:
Mutiyat sells bags of charcoal and she has been in this business for four years. She is 35 years old and married with four children.

Mutiyat hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mwansity

texts.en:
Mwansity H. is married and is a Tanzanian business entrepreneur. She runs a café at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She has been running the business for six years and the business income helps her to meet her family’s daily demands. She sells a variety of food to customers, both cooked and fried. Ingredients are purchased from the city market.

Mwansity H. needs a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to buy more ingredients to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients

loans.name: Kadiri

texts.en:
Kadiri is 50 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions like noodles, milk, detergent, eggs, etc.

Kadiri hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She hopes to own a big supermarket in future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine M. is a married woman and a Tanzanian business entrepreneur. She is a livestock keeper specializing in poultry. She keeps both broilers and layers at her poultry cages. It takes almost six months to get the first lays. She collects and sells ten trays of eggs per day and sells both wholesale and retail.

Valentine has been in the business for ten years and the business income has enabled her to meet her daily family needs and has enabled her to capitalize the business. It has also enabled her to buy a plot of land and to build her house.

Valentine needs a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to boost her business.

loans.use: To boost her business by buying more chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Sion Plus Group

texts.fr:
Arise K. 30 ans, est président de la Banque Communautaire dénommée « Sion Plus » constituée de 25 membres solidairement unis pour recevoir des prêts chez Kiva à travers l’IMF HOPE RDC dans le but de développer leurs activités. 
Arise a commencé son activité en 1998 avec un capital initial de $50. Il gère sa propre boucherie au marché situé à l’ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Il est client fidèle de l’IMF HOPE RDC qui a déjà reçu 3 fois les crédits et les a remboursés correctement. Il compte avec le prochain prêt acheter des vivres frais à revendre en vue d’augmenter le bénéfice. Son activité lui procure par jour, un bénéfice de $12. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une chambre froide. Arise est célibataire avec 2 enfants âgés de 8 et 9 ans. Tous deux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Arise K., aged 30, is the president of the Banque Communautaire “Sion Plus”, which is composed of 25 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. Arise started his business in 1998 with $50 in initial capital. He manages his own butcher shop at the market located west of the city of Kinshasa. He is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received three different loans and has repaid them properly. He intends to use the next loan to buy fresh staple goods to resell with the aim of increase his profits. Each day, his business brings in a profit of $12. His ambition is to open a cold storage facility. Arise is unmarried and has two children, who are 8 and 9 years old. Both of them go to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh staple foods to resell for increasing his income

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Filget

texts.en:
Filget N. lives in the small village of Lenkoran. He works very hard and is dedicated to the cattle business in order to bring food to his table for his wife and beloved five children. From very early in the morning he tends to the animals. He returns in the afternoons having been exposed to the sun and exhausted from all his dilligent work. Filget says that he works with only one aim in mind – to provide his three children with a proper education.

Now, Filget would like to expand his business and purchase two calves. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 2,000 USD and, with your help, he hopes to reach his aim. Be an important part of the growth of Filget’s business.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Mayasa

texts.en:
Mayasa A. is a Tanzanian business woman and entrepreneur in the Kitunda ward in Dar es Salaam. She runs a shop that sells different types of spare parts for cars.

Mayasa purchases her resale goods from the big retail shops in the Kariakoo city business center. Her business requires high capital because the goods are expensive. Mayasa is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 Tanzanian shillings (TZS) to buy more resale goods in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional spare car parts for resale in order to expand her business.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German vive en la calle  “San Agustín” de la zona  Juana Azurduy de padilla, la cual se encuentra en una zona periférica de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en una casa propiedad de la empresa en la que trabaja. 

Trabaja como cuidador y chofer a la vez, puesto que la empresa le dio tres cuartos para que el y su familia vivan.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materiales de construcción para la reparación de uno de los cuartos donde viven sus hijos y así puedan tener mayor comodidad.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro; la evaluación realizada califica a German para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
German lives on San Agustín Street in the Juana Azurduy de Padilla region, which is in the outskirts of the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and children in a house that belongs to the company he works for. He works at the same time as a caretaker and a driver. Because of his job the company gave him three rooms for his family to live in. The loan is to buy construction materials to repair one of the rooms where his children live. This way they will be able to be more comfortable. This is his second loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies German for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sand, stucco, and paint to repair one of the rooms where his children live

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia sells cooked foods and drinks. She is 40 years old and married with 8 children. She has been in business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N60000 to purchase drinks and foodstuffs to sell.

She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Doreen's Group

texts.en:
K. Doreen is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 30 years old and married with children who are all in school. She has had a hotel business in Kanyarugiri for over 3 years.

Her loyalty, accompanied by quality food and loans make it possible for Doreen to succeed.  Doreen prepares all kinds of local food and sauce.  She needs a loan to help expand her hotel with more variety of foodstuffs.  This can help her provide her children with a quality education. 

She is grateful for her loans since she is gaining from all of them.

loans.use: Buying more foodstuffs for her hotel and paying school fees.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 50 years old and married with 8 children. She sells drinks and cooked foods. She is requesting a loan amount of N60000 to purchase drinks and foodstuffs to sell.

She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan vive en la calle  “Gaceta del Sur” de la zona  Villa Exaltación, de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en casa propia, actualmente se encuentra divorciado de su esposa con la cual tiene una pequeña hija. 

Trabaja como tramitador en un estudio jurídico, en la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materiales de construcción (arena , cemento, ladrillo y fierro) para su  vivienda, la cual se encuentra en etapa de construcción.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Hernan lives on Southern Gazette Street in the Villa Exaltation zone of the city of El Alto. He lives in his own house, and is presently divorced from his wife with whom he has a small daughter. He works as a clerk in a law school in the city of La Paz.

His loan is for the purchase of construction materials (sand, cement, bricks, and reinforcement rods) for his house, which is still under construction. This is his first loan with IMPRO. Their completed evaluation found him qualified to receive it.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY BASIC CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS TO CONTINUE BUILDING HIS HOUSE

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is thirty years old. He is divorced and has given birth to one child, a boy in school. He lives with his son in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town.

William is a refrigerator repairer. He repairs broken refrigerators for clients in his community. William has been in business for three years and has a number of apprentices in training.

William reports that sometimes the refrigerators he repairs need replacement parts. He wants to take the opportunity to provide and sell some of these spare parts to his clients. William is requesting a loan to buy refrigerator spare parts for resale.

loans.use: To buy refrigerator spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir M. is 52 years old and is married with three children. He sells food products such as candies, cookies, macaroni and rice and has been in this business for about seven years. The income he generates allows him to support his family, for whom he is the sole breadwinner.

Now, Zakir is requesting 2,000 USD to purchase sweets (candies) to enlarge the range of goods he offers. He thanks you for all your support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To enlarge his range of goods

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is twenty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children. Both are currently in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming community in the region.

Martha is a baker. She works hard to provide for her family. She bakes bread to sell wholesale and retail. She supplies to other retailers and beverage sellers in her community. Martha buys bags of flour and other ingredients from nearby communities at affordable prices. She has been in business for five years now and is requesting a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour to produce baked goods for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha O. is a Tanzanian married woman who is a small business entrepreneur. Mwanaisha is a food vendor in the Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells both cooked and fried food, as well as soft drinks, to customers.

Mwanaisha has been running the business for five years. Income from her business has enabled her to meet her family’s daily needs. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Tanzanian shillings (TZS) to buy more raw materials in order to meet her customers’ demand.

loans.use: To buy more goods for resale in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is sixty years old. She is widowed and has given birth to seven children. Some of her children are currently in school. She lives with them in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming community in the region.

She works hard to provide for the family. Akua is a food vendor who prepares and sells mashed kenkey. She prepares the food in her house and sells it by hawking it in her community. Akua buys bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby communities at affordable prices. She has been in business for over thirty years, and now she wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy bags of maize

loans.name: Jennifer's Group

texts.en:
B. Jennifer is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 29 years old and married with 3 children, all of whom are her dependents. She has a drug shop business in Kanyarugiri that she has been running for 8 years. She has strategically positioned her business to enable her to make more money as long as she has the necessary stock.

She hopes to turn her drug shop into a pharmacy and to have a happy and educated family. At the moment, she makes 150,000/= in profits, and she would like to increase this. She needs a loan to help buy more stock for her drug shop to avoid a shortage. She is really determined to prosperous.

loans.use: Buy more drugs for her shop

loans.name: Maula

texts.en:
Maula M. is an entrepreneurial Tanzanian business woman. She is married and runs a food shop business at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases and sells a variety of food products to retail customers. Business goods are purchased in wholesale from the shops and marketed at Kariakoo trading city center.

She has been running the business for four years and uses the income to fulfill her daily family demands and for business capitalization. She would appreciate a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to buy more food products to resell to her customers.

loans.use: Buy more food products to resell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 25 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children. All of the children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. 

Mary is a trader. She trades in textile materials such as silk, wool, linen, etc. She supplies to tailors and dressmakers in her community. Mary has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy textile materials in bulk.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy phone credits

loans.name: Ben's Group

texts.en:
Ben R. is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is a friendly, hardworking and determined man with a veterinary drug shop in the Kanyarugiri trading center. His 15 years of experience has won him customers’ trust and confidence. 

He works so hard to ensure that his drug shop expands and to have better education and a bright future of his family. In a week, Ben is able to make 80,000 Ugandan shillings as profits. He needs a loan to be able to increase stock in his drug shop to avoid shortages.

loans.use: Buying more drugs for the veterinary shop

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 28 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children. Both are currently in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming community in the region. 

She works hard to provide for the family. Patience is a trader. She runs a cold store. She sells fresh fish and all kinds of meat. She supplies to other retailers and food vendors in her community. Patience buys cartons of fresh fish and meat from big cold stores in Kumasi. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and meat

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is twenty – five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. Both are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Rita is a hairdresser by profession. She has a workshop by the road side in her community. She says she has four apprentices under training. Rita has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy artificial hair and other working materials in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair

loans.name: Jany

texts.es:
Jany  es una mujer extrovertida y muy colaboradora, ella tiene 23 años de edad,es soltera, estudia educación para nivel inicial; también se dedica a la costura, trabaja junto a  su tía en la confección de hamacas, hace flores y bisutería. Ella vive con sus padres  y les ayuda en los gastos familiares. Es integrante del Banco Comunal “Las Heroínas”, donde forma parte hace tres años, su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles y lo utilizó para solventar gastos del hogar, sus estudios y en la compra de materiales para confeccionar hamacas. 
Con este crédito de S/. 1,500, comprará telas para confeccionar hamacas, cabo y pretinas. La meta  de Jany tener sus propias máquinas para poder confeccionar las hamacas y poder exportar y también tener un local propio.

loans.use: Invertirá en telas para confeccionar hamacas, cabo y pretinas.

loans.name: Issah

texts.en:
Issah is forty-five years old. He is married and has three children. All are still in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town.

Issah is a trader. He deals in firewood. He buys the firewood from nearby communities at affordable prices and then supplies it to food vendors and restaurant operators in his community.

Issah is requesting a loan to buy the firewood in bulk so he can supply to more customers. He has been in business for eight years.

loans.use: To buy firewood in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase food products

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all sons, who are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Wiawso in the Western Region. She works hard to support her husband and to provide for their family.

Nana is a trader. She runs a roadside shop selling provisions in her community. Nana buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices. She is requesting a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business. She has been in business for five years.

loans.use: To buy provisions for resale in her roadside shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cartons of soap for resale at community markets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De Huambalpa Group

texts.es:
La Comunidad de Huambalpa pertenece al distrito de Huambalpa, provincia de Vilcashuaman, departamento de Ayacucho, la comunidad se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Vilcas, su actividad primordial es la agricultura y la ganadería, Su producción mas productiva son los cereales y los tubérculos, como la papa.

Celedonia es casada y tiene 02 hijos, ella se dedica a vender abarrotes en su comunidad, los cuales trae desde la ciudad con la ayuda de su esposo y sus hijos. Gracias a su empeño y los préstamos obtenidos, su negocio a podido crecer. Celedonia solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería y así surtir su negocio. Ella, se encuentra ahorrando para poder financiar los estudios de sus hijos.

Tarcila es casada y tiene 05 hijos. Tarcila se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y a dar pensión a los docentes y personas que visitantes de su comunidad, negocio que le va muy bien y en el cual le ayuda su esposo y sus hijos cuando están de vacaciones. Ella necesita un préstamo para poder comprar mercadería para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Huambalpa community belongs to the Huambalpa district, Vilcashuaman province, Ayacucho department. The community is located ten minutes from the city of Vilcas. Farming and livestock are the main activities. Their most productive products are grains and tubers like potatoes. Celedonia is married and has two children. She sells groceries in her community. She brings them from the city with help from her husband and children. Thanks to her effort and the loans she has received, her business has been able to grow. Celedonia is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to stock her business. She is saving to pay for her children’s education. Tarcila is married and has five children. Tarcila sells groceries and provides meals for the teachers and people who visit her community. The business is going very well. Her husband and their children help her when they are on vacation. She needs a loan to be able to buy merchandise for her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: St. Peters Group

texts.en: Gladys is forty – two years old. She is married and has give birth to three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Gladys is a trader. She trades in second hand clothes. She is the leader of a trust bank group called St. Peters. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. Some of them also trek to other towns to sell. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
Nabi S. is 52 year old and has sold food products in the small village of Lenkoran since 1999. He is married and has four children who are the meaning of his life. He is dedicated to his shop where he sells candies and canned food.

Nabi applied for a 2,000 USD loan in order to increase and diversify the range of products he sells.

loans.use: To increase and diversify the range of products he sells

loans.name: Jah Bless Group

texts.en: Rebecca is thirty – nine years old. She is divorced and has give birth to three children, all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Rebecca is a trader. She trades in textile materials.  She is the leader of a trust bank group called Jah Bless. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Dina

texts.fr: Z. Dina est née le 13/09/1976 à Agblangandan à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Dina est mariée à DJOSSOU Frédéric. Dina est mère d’un enfant. Dina et sa famille habitent AGLA un quartier de Cotonou. Dina a été initiée au commerce dès son enfance par sa mère qui vendait des lubrifiants pour véhicules. Dina a aussi appris la coiffure qu’elle a exercé pendant trois ans avant de l’abandonner au profit du commerce. Dina vend en effet des mèches de tissages et de tresses ainsi que les produits cosmétiques.Dina a pour ambition et projet d’ouvrir une grande boutique de produits de toilette et de produits de coiffures. Dina a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de la part d’ALIDé. Dina a bien remboursé ce prêt et sollicite aujourd’hui un second pour augmenter le volume de son activité, son revenu et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Achat de produits de beauté et de coiffure.

loans.name: Bowoho Moden Group

texts.en: Daniel is thirty – two years old. He is single and has no child. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Daniel is a chef in a local basic school. He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Bowoho moden’, literally meaning, strive hard. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of manure as fertilizer

loans.name: Qorkhmaz

texts.en:
Qorkhmaz M. is a 35-year-old man who breeds cattle in the small village of Lenkoran. He is married and has three children.

Qorkhmaz has bred cattle for the last nine years. During the same time he has been working as a waiter in the local restaurants where he sells cattle for meat production.

Qorkhmaz’s main source of income is cattle breeding and he would like to dedicate all his strength to develop this business. He believes that one day he could have a big herd and finish his career as a waiter. To increase the number of his cattle, he applied for 2,000 USD. He believes this loan will help him to one day approach his dream.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: K. Bernadette est née le 20/05/1973 à Cotonou. Bernadette est Mariée à TOSSOU Antoine, un mécanicien auto. Bernadette est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés: GIOVANNI et KHALEB. Bernadette et sa famille vivent à Agla, un quartier de Cotonou. Bernadette a ouvert son atelier de couture il y a cinq ans et y vend également des articles de mercerie. Bernadette a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits de la part d’ALIDé. Bernadette a bien remboursé ces prêts  et sollicite aujourd’hui un troisième pour augmenter le volume de son activité, son revenu et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
K. Bernadette is born 05/20/1973 in Cotonou. Bernadette is married to TOSSOU Antoine, an auto mechanic. Bernadette is the mother of two children, GIOVANNI and KHALEB, all in school. Bernadette and her family live in Alga, a neighborhood of Cottonou. Bernadette opened her sewing shop five years ago and she also sells sewing supplies in the shop. Bernadette already received two loans from ALIDE and repaid correctly these loans and is requesting today, a third in order to increase the bulk of her business, her income and to satisfy better her customers.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: . Purchase of 10 bags of zippers, sewing thread, rolls of fabric etc

loans.name: Sheyla

texts.es:
Sheyla es una mujer trabajadora, creativa y dinámica, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos adolescentes, se dedica a la preparación y decoración de tortas, también tiene una bodega que funciona en su casa, su esposo la apoya en todo lo quiere emprender, él es obrero de construcción civil. Hace cuatro años que viene siendo socia del banco comunal “Guadalupe”; su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, el cual invirtió en la venta de comida.
COn este crédito de S/.  1500 soles,  invertirá en la compra de abarrotes y en la compra de telas al por mayor. La meta de Sheyla  es terminar de hacer el piso de su casa y seguir apoyando a su esposo en la educación de sus 2 menores hijos.
texts.en:
Sheyla is a hard working, creative, and dynamic woman. She is 36, married, and has two adolescent children. She makes and decorates cakes. She also has a store in her house. Her husband supports her in everything she wants to undertake. He is a civil construction worker. She has been a member of the Guadalupe Communal Bank for four years. She used her first loan of 300 PEN for food sales. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy groceries and wholesale fabric. Sheyla’s goal is to finish the floor in her house. She also wants to continue helping her husband with the education of their two children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her grocery business and buy fabric

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Hortencia  es una persona extrovertida y muy atenta, tiene 44 años de edad y se dedica hace varios años a su empresa de transportes de motokar, donde tiene como socia a su hermana. La ruta de transporte de su agencia de motokar es dentro de la ciudad de Pucallpa, también tiene una bodega en su casa y trabaja junto a su mamá. Es madre soltera, tiene un hijo ya mayor de edad ,que lo apoya mucho. Ella pertenece hace tres años al Banco Comunal “Guadalupe”. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles y lo invirtió en su bodega. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000 soles, piensa invertir una parte en su bodega comprando productos como leche, azúcar, arroz, etc. y otra parte invertirá en el arreglo de su local donde funciona su empresa de motokar. Su meta es tener una tienda de repuestos en general  para motos y motokar y así seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Hortencia is a very extroverted and thoughtful person. She is 44. For several years she has had a transportation by “motocarro” (a three wheeled motorized cart) business in the city of Pucallpa. She also has a store in her house, and she works with her mother. She is a single mother with one child who is now grown. She gives him lots of support. She has belonged to the Guadalupe Communal Bank for three years. With her first loan for 300 PEN she invested in her store. She plans to use part of this loan for 3,000 PEN to buy products like milk, sugar, and rice, etc. for her store. She will use the other part to fix up the location where she has her motocarro business. Her goal is to have a replacement parts store for motorcycles and motocarros. This way she will continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix up her location and buy products like rice, eggs, noodles, sugar, and more for her store

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba  es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica  que lucha por sus ideales, tiene  40 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos, todos mayores de edad. Se dedica a la venta de repuestos de motos y motokar, ella trabaja con su esposo en su negocio de vulcanizado de llantas y repuestos. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Heroínas” desde hace dos años . Ella obtuvo un primer préstamo de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la apertura de su negocio de repuestos para motos y motokar. 
Con este crédito de S/. 2,300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de un motokar. Su meta es agrandar su taller y comprarse otra compresora.
texts.en:
Elba is a dynamic, enterprising woman who fights for her ideals. She is 40 years old, and is the mother of three grown children. She sells motorcycle and motorcar (light, 3-wheeled vehicle) parts, working with her husband in his tire repair and spare parts business. She has been a member of the “Las Heroínas” communal bank for two years. She obtained her first loan of 300 soles, and this amount was invested in the opening of her motorcycle and motorcar parts business. With this loan of 2,300 soles, she will purchase a motorcar. Her goal is to increase her repair shop and to purchase another compressor.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a motorcar (light, 3-wheeled vehicle)

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid R. has worked for many years in the difficult business of raising cattle. After purchasing his cattle, he provides them with all the right conditions for their growth: taking care of their food and protection and making sure they don’t get lost. Once they’re fully mature, he sells them in his area and also provides their milk for sale.

Currently, Khalid needs to purchase cattle to raise and for this reason he is turning to AqroInvest to obtain a loan of 2,000 USD. He thanks Kiva for the support that it presents to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes  es una mujer sencilla y dinámica, tiene 62 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad que la apoyan mucho. Ella tiene una bodega y trabaja junto a una de sus hijas, también es propietaria de un motokar que la ayuda a generar un poco más de ingresos económicos. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Guadalupe”, desde hace cuatro años. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles y lo invirtió en la apertura de su bodega. 
Con este crédito de S/ 1,700 nuevos soles, comprará un motokar y algunos productos para su bodega como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc.
La meta de Mercedes es seguir trabajando para poderse comprar otro motokar y de esta manera apoyar en los estudios a su sobrino que aún es menor de edad.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a very down to earth and dynamic woman. She is 62, and she has seven grown children who give her a lot of support. She has a convenience store, and she works with one of her daughters. She also has a “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized cart), which helps her generate a little more income. She has been a member of the Guadalupe Communal Bank for four years. She used her first loan for 300 PEN to open her store. With this loan for 1,700 PEN she will buy a motocarro and some products like rice, sugar, noodles, and milk, etc. for her store. Mercedes’ goal is to keep working to be able to buy another motocarro. This way she can help her nephew, who is still a minor, with his education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her store and buy a motocarro

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy vegetables like cabbage, tomatoes, onions, and peppers for resale at the community market.

loans.name: Shirmammad

texts.en:
Shirmammad S. is a humble man who earns a living in the cattle-farming business. He is the father of six daughters, who motivate him to work harder every day to be able to meet their needs. As he is a very respectable man in the village he lives in, Shirmammad is responsible for providing all his daughters with a good dowry.

It is important to note that Shirmammad’s business requires a lot of physical work, mainly because he needs to transport the animals from one point to another, crossing long distances under the exposure of the sun. Shirmammad pastures his cattle without any help and continues to work hard. He has now come to AqroInvest to obtain the loan that will allow him to purchase young bulls to raise and sell in his area.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Ayabavi Renée

texts.fr:
A. Ayabavi Renée est née en 1953 à Abidjan en Côte-d’Ivoire. Ayabavi Renée est allée à l’école jusqu'en classe de CM2. Ayabavi Renée est Mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Ayabavi Renée et ses enfants habitent dans sa maison familiale au quartier Sainte Rita à Cotonou. Ayabavi Renée a été très tôt initiée au commerce par sa tutrice. Apres plusieurs années de services rendus à cette dernière, Ayabavi Renée s’est installée à son propre compte pour mener son petit commerce: vente de balais et de paniers. Ensuite, Ayabavi Renée a vendu des vivres (farine de manioc, haricot, maïs). Aujourd'hui Ayabavi Renée
 fait la transformation de soja en fromage. Ayabavi Renée veut pouvoir acheter le soja en gros et commencer par livrer aussi le fromage de soja en gros aux revendeurs et à ceux qui vendent à manger. C’est pour cette raison Ayabavi Renée sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Ayabavi Renée was born in 1953 in Abidjan, Cote-d’Ivoire. She went to school through the 5th grade. She is the mother of six children who are all in school. Ayabavi Renée and her children live in the family house in the Sainte Rita district in Cotonou. Early on, she was introduced to commerce by her guardian. After several years of service rendered to her, Ayabavi Renée got situated on her own running a small business: selling brooms and baskets. Then, she sold staple foods (cassava flour, beans, corn). Today, she makes soybeans into tofu (soy cheese). She wants to be able to buy soybeans in bulk and to start by delivering tofu wholesale to retailers and to food caterers. For this reason, she's requesting financial support from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of soybeans and drums of vegetable oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build up an inventory of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy linen, silk, textiles, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
