Isaac is twenty–four years old. He is single and has no children. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. 

Isaac is a mobile phone credit vendor and sometimes sells phone accessories. He sells on a table top under a tree in his community. Isaac has been in business for one year now and desires to expand his business. He sells credit for all kinds of networks.  He therefore wants a loan to buy more credits to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy phone credits and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase corn grain.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce started a local restaurant ten years ago and since then she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now forty years-old. She serves many kinds of local dishes such as fufu, rice balls, and banku. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and eaten with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and eaten with hot pepper or soup.

Joyce would like to use this loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, and firewood. She hopes to use part of the proceeds to expand her business. She would be grateful for assistance.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supplement her stock of fish.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua is thirty – eight years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, two daughters and three sons who are currently in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Afua is a trader. She is into palm oil production business. She supplies to retailers in her community. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. Afua has been in business for over eleven years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Inna

texts.en: Inna is married with two children. She sells clothing at small markets located in the area. Inna has been in this business for 13 years. She enjoys selling clothing. She has got many repeated clients that use her services. Inna is a hard working and much disciplined person. She makes sure that she has items that her clients would want to buy from her. Inna would like to borrow 6,100 UAH to increase the assortment. This business is the only source of income for Inna and her family.

loans.use: to increase the assortmetn

loans.name: Corazones De Oro Group

texts.es:
Silvia Justa O. presidenta del grupo “Corazones de Oro”, que pertenece al Centro Focal “Los Andes”, dirige su reunión  y juntas elaborán su reglamente interno. Este grupo se funda hace aproximadadamente 5 años, todas sus integrantes tienen diversas actividades económicas como tejido de prendas de vestir, compra y venta de ropa, papa, pan, revistas y comida. Un ejemplo claro es Carmen Q. de 25 años, vende revistas en la feria 16 de Julio y desea adquirir más mercadería, otra integrante es Neri C. de 33 años, vende pan en la ex tranca de Rio Seco, todos los días y quiere incrementar su mercadería. Tereza C. de 59 años vende ropa en diferentes provincias como Achacachi y Palcoco.
Todas ellas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y materia prima
texts.en:
Silvia Justa O., president of the “Corazones de Oro” Group (a branch of the Los Andes hub), leads the group members, and together they work within their internal regulations. This group was founded approximately 5 years ago. The group members have different businesses, such as knitting apparel, buying and selling clothing, potatoes, bread, magazines, and food sales. A clear example is Carmen Q., age 25, who sells magazines at the 16 de Julio market. She would like to obtain more merchandise. Another member is Neri C., age 33, who sells bread in Ex Tranca Rio Seco every day, and wants to increase her inventory. Tereza C., age 59, sells clothing throughout several provinces, like Achacachi and Palcoco.

They all need the loan to purchase merchandise and raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Kristel

texts.es:
Kristel es una joven  soltera, carismática y trabajadora, tiene 20 años de edad, es estudiante de la facultad de  Derecho de la  Universidad Nacional de Ucayali,  se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, pues trae de Lima la mercadería y la vende a sus amistades. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su mamá. Es integrante del Banco Comunal “Las Heroínas” desde hace un año. Empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en su negocio de compra de carteras. 
Con este préstamo es de 1000 soles, comprará prendas de vestir y accesorios como correas para damas, pulseras y otros. Su meta es terminar su carrera y obtener su titulo universitario.
texts.en:
Kristel is a charismatic, hardworking young woman. At 20 years old she studies in the faculty of Law in the National University of Icayali and sells items of clothing to her friends that she brings from Lima. She is supported by her mother and has been a member of the community bank “Las Heroínas” (the Heroines) for one year. She began with a loan of 300 soles that allowed her to invest in her business by purchasing wallets. With this loan of 1000 soles, she will buy articles of clothing and accessories such as belts for women, bracelets and other items. Her goal is to finish her course and obtain a university title.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of items of clothing and accessories

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una persona dinámica y colaboradora, tiene 40 años de edad, es casada,  tiene un hijo mayor de edad; ella es profesora de nivel primario y también se dedica a confeccionar hamacas. Su local de ventas esta ubicado en el lado exterior del mercado número 1, ubicado en la ciudad de Pucallpa, donde trabaja  junto a su esposo. Ella  forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Heroínas” desde hace cinco años; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300 soles y lo invirtió en la apertura de su negocio actual. 
COn este préstamo de S/. 1,000 soles, invertirá en la compra de telas, para confeccionar hamacas y algunos otros  productos relacionados a su negocio. La meta de Carmen es tener otro local  en esta ciudad para poder ofrecer estos mismos productos  y así tener mas clientes.

loans.use: Invertirá en la compra de telas, para confeccionar hamacas y algunos otros  productos

loans.name: Merly

texts.es: Merly es una mujer emprendedora que lucha por sus ideales. Tiene 20 años de edad y un hijo de 2 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado en el mercado de San Fernando, esta actividad la realiza por las mañanas y por las tardes sale a ofrecer su pescado en su motokar por algunas zonas alejadas del  centro de la ciudad. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es chofer de motokar. Merly es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Corajes”, desde hace 2 años. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles y lo invirtió en la compra de pescado; Con este préstamo de 1000 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más pescado y el financiamiento para adquirir otro motokar, que le permita tener otra fuente de ingresos. Su meta es llegar a tener un kiosco bien surtido y de esta manera ayudar a su esposo en la economía de su  hogar.
texts.en:
Merly is an enterprising woman who fights for her ideals. She is 20 years old and has a two-year-old child. She sells fish in the morning at the market in San Fernando. In the evenings she sells fish from her motorcar in the outskirts of the city with the support of her husband, who drives. Merly has been a member of the "Mujeres Corajes" Village Bank for the past two years. Her first loan of 300 soles was invested in the purchase of fish. The loan of 1000 soles she requests now will be invested in the purchase of even more fish and to finance the acquisition of another motorcar, which will give her another source of income. Her goal is to have a well-stocked kiosk so that in this way she can help her husband with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fish and a motorcar

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo
texts.en: Alfredo

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to grow Passion Fruit.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana  es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo, ella tiene 75 años de edad, es viuda  y tiene 9 hijos mayores de edad con quienes comparte el trabajo, pues ella se dedica a la crianza de aves, como pollos, patos, pavos, también tiene cinco parcelas de sembríos de yuca. Juanita pertenece al Banco Comunal “Guadalupe”, es una socia muy puntual  en sus pagos, empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles y lo invirtió en el mantenimiento de su galpón. 
Con este préstamo de 1500 soles, comprará alimentos balanceados para sus aves y también comprará patos y pollitos para colocarlos en su granja. Su meta es aumentar un galpón para la crianza de las aves  y de esta manera contribuir con los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: comprará alimentos balanceados.  Compra de animales menores (patos y pollitos) para aumentar su granja

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La asociacion “Nueva Esperaza” se reúne quincenalmente el centro focal Villa Exaltación, a la fecha esta formada por catorce mujeres que trabajan de forma responsable cumpliendo su doceavo ciclo junto a Pro-Mujer. 
Tienen distintas actividades como ser la costura, un oficio de hace muchos años de Olga L., otras de las socias se dedican a la venta de mantillas, frazadas, frutas, artículos en porcelana y producción de ladrillos.
 Todas estas mujeres precisan de dinero principalmente para la compra de materia prima, necesitan obtener mayor rentabilidad en sus negocios.
texts.en:
"Nueva Esperanza" (new hope) is a group of 14 women, each with her own distinct business, who are completing their twelfth borrowing cycle with Pro-Mujer. They meet every two weeks at Pro-Mujer's regional center Villa Exaltación.

Some are seamstresses, like Olga L., who has many years' experience. Others' businesses are include selling blankets, children's wear, fruits or porcelain. Some manufacture bricks.

They will purchase raw materials with the loan to increase the profitability of their enterprises.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Alvaro Gerardo

texts.es:
Alvaro Gerardo C. B. es un señor de 48 años de edad, quien vive con su esposa y uno de sus tres hijos en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada San Gabriel, localizada en Yolillal, Upala en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural  con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi montañosa ubicada en Costa Rica, Centroamérica. Sus actividades principales son  la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala la ganadería.

Desde hace ya varios años don Alvaro se dedica a la ganadería de doble propósito. Logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de los productos que ofrece. En su caso en particular, la demanda es mayor de lo que puede ofrecer actualmente. 

Don Alvaro considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, él y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y ha logrado ser actores en el desarrollo de la comunidad.

Actualmente don Alvaro desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones), para comprar 3 vacas y así  poder incrementar la producción. El sabe que contar con mayor número de vacas más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser un microempresario exitoso y sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, lo motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero. 

Don Alvaro forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Gabriel, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  primer crédito y dice que con el espera poder seguir creciendo como microempresario y sacar su negocio adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.

loans.use: Compra de 3 vacas

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris es una persona trabajadora y jovial, ella  tiene 30 años de edad y es madre de tres niños, todos menores de edad; se dedica a la costura (lencería) para ello cuenta con una máquina de coser y una remalladota; su esposo se dedica a la venta de madera. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “ Las  Heroínas” desde hace un año. Doris empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles y lo invirtió en el mantenimiento de su máquina de coser. Con este préstamo de 1800 soles, comprará telas, hilos, elástico y dará mantenimiento a su motokar. La meta  de Doris es tener su propio taller de costura y ser propietaria de un restaurant.
texts.en:
Doris is a hardworking and cheerful woman. She is 30 years old and is the mother of three young children. She is a lingerie seamstress and has a sewing machine, as well as a specialist sewing machine. Her husband sells wood. Doris has been a member of the “Las Heroínas” community bank for the past year. She began with a 300 PEN loan, and invested it in the maintenance of her sewing machine. With this loan of 1800 PEN, she will purchase fabric, thread, elastic, and invest in the maintenance of her “motokar”. Doris’ goal is to have her own sewing shop and to be a restaurant owner.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, elastic, and the maintenance of her 'motokar'

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery  es una mujer trabajadora  y entusiasta, ella tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y tienen dos hijos mayores de edad. Ella vende comida por las noches, en la vereda de su casa, la ayuda en esta actividad una de sus hijas. Su esposo la apoya siempre, él  es empleado de una agencia postal. Mery pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Heroínas” desde hace dos años, su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la implementación de su negocio, compró algunos insumos necesarios para la elaboración de sus alimentos.
Con este préstamo de 1000, comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite; también comprará otra mesa para atender a su público. La meta de Mery es tener una tienda  de artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Mery is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman. She is 45 years old and lives with her husband. They have two grown children. Mery sells food at night on the sidewalk in front of her house, and her daughter helps her. Her husband always supports her – he works at a postal agency. Mery has belonged to the “Las Heroínas” community bank for the past two years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she invested in the implementation of her business. She bought supplies to make her foods.

With this loan of 1000 PEN, Mery will purchase rice, sugar, pasta, and oil. She will also buy another table to wait on the customers. Mery’s goal is to have a household goods store.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, pasta, oil, and another table

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
Flora María O. C. es una joven señora de 26 años de edad, quien vive con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada San Gabriel, localizada en Yolillal, Upala en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural  con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi montañosa ubicada en Costa Rica, Centroamérica. Sus actividades principales son  la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería

Desde muy joven doña Flor se ha dedicado a la agricultura específicamente a la siembra de arroz, por lo tanto, dice que tiene bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo tiene un terreno en el cual ha sembrado arroz anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirlo por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente. Comenta también que se siente muy orgullosa de si misma ya que ha podido ver como su proyecto ha crecido gracias a la dedicación y esfuerzo que ha tenido.

En estos momentos lo que solicita doña Flor es un micro crédito de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones), para ayudarse con  la preparación del terreno, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del arroz y lograr una buena cosecha.

Doña Flor forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Gabriel, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  su tercer crédito y dice que con el espera seguir creciendo como microempresaria y sacar su negocio adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.

loans.use: Mantenimiento y compra de insumos para siembra de arroz.

loans.name: Genesis

texts.es:
Génesis es una persona dinámica y entusiasta, tiene 19 años de edad y es madre de un niño de 1 año.  Tiene un pequeño negocio de abarrotes en su casa. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja en una fábrica de calaminas en la ciudad de Pucallpa. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “ Mujeres Corajes”, desde hace un año.  Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles el cual lo invirtió en golosinas.
Con este préstamo S/ 1000 soles, comprará una vitrina que le permitirá exhibir mejor sus productos, y de esta manera tener mas clientes. La meta de Génesis es tener un negocio de lencería ya  que a ella le gusta la costura y así poder contribuir a los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Génesis is a dynamic and enthusiastic person. She is 19 years old and is the mother of a one-year-old boy. She has a small grocery business in her home. She has the support of her husband, who works in a corrugated iron factory in the city of Pucallpa. She has been a member of the "Mujeres Corajes" Village Bank for a year. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she invested in candies. With this loan of 1000 soles, she will buy a display case to show off her products and attract more clients. Génesis's goal is to have a lingerie shop since she likes to sew and could contribute more to the household expenditures this way.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic goods and a product display case

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel N. P. es un señor de 41 años, vecino de Los Tijos de Upala, localizado en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural  con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi montañosa ubicada en Costa Rica, Centroamérica.  La comunidad se dedica especialmente a la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería. Vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos.

Desde hace 3 años don Angel se dedica a la siembra de papaya, por lo tanto, dice que posee bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo, tiene un pequeño  terreno en el cual ha sembrado papaya anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirla por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Angel es un micro crédito de ¢680,000 (seiscientos ochenta mil colones), para comprar fertilizantes, semillas, y diferentes insumos para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su cosecha, así al final podrá ser recompensado y podrá tener una muy buena producción. 

Don Angel forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Los Tijos, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  su tercer crédito y dice que con el espera seguir creciendo como microempresario y sacar su negocio adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Angel N. P. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and their two children in Los Tijos de Upala, located in the province of Alajuela. It is a rural community with a relatively large area and somewhat mountainous topography, located in Costa Rica. The community works especially in the agriculture of basic grains, and on a lessor scale, raising livestock. For 3 years Angel has worked sowing papaya seeds. Therefore, he says he possesses quite a lot of experience in the care and maintenance of this kind of cultivation. He has a small plot of land in which he has planted papaya previously and has had very good results. Because of this, he wishes to expand his plantation. Thanks to this business, his family's quality of life has improved considerably. What Angel is currently requesting is a loan of ¢680,000 colones to buy fertilizer, seeds, and different materials in order to give the best maintenance and assistance possible to his harvest. This way he will be rewarded and will be able to have a very good production. Angel is a part of the Empresa de Credito Comunal de Los Tijos, one of 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his third credit, and he says that with it he hopes to continue growing as a small entrepreneur and keep his business moving forward. He also emphasizes that thanks to these types of organizations and means of facilitating credit, he is able to dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of materials for planting and maintaining papaya.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es:
Teresita  es una socia activa y trabajadora, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre de seis hijos mayores de edad y  tiene una tienda de abarrotes muy surtido, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en este trabajo. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Laboriosas II” desde hace cuatro años. Ella inicio su crédito con 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la ampliación de su tienda de abarrotes (compró diversos productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos). 
Con este crédito de S/ 1000 soles, comprará artículos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda (comprará fideos, azúcar, arroz, detergente, etc.)
texts.en:
Teresita has been an active member of her communal bank “Las Laboriosas II” for 4 years and is a hard worker. She is 55 years old and the mother of 6 children, all of whom are grown Teresita has a well stocked vegetable store and counts on her husband's support to help her with the business. Teresita invested a loan of 300 soles to enlarge her store and to buy products like rice, sugar, and spaghetti. With this loan of 1000 soles, she again plans to buy items needed to stock her store like spaghetti, rice, detergents etc.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will invest in purchase of items for store.

loans.name: Leili

texts.es:
Leili  es un mujer  emprendedora, de 37 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mercadería de prendas de vestir, abarrotes, calzados. Ella ofrece estos productos en los diferentes mercados, los dá a crédito, para luego  cobrar diariamente. Trabaja con ella un sobrino que se encarga de la cobranza. Leili es  socia del Banco Comunal “Las Flores” desde hace cinco años y se caracteriza por poner siempre en orden a su banco. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, invirtió este dinero artículos como jabón, detergentes de ropa, queso, yogurt. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2500 soles, comprará otra moto ya que la necesita para realizar sus cobranzas. La meta de Leili es tener un local propio donde pueda vender sus productos, y seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Leili is an enterprising 37-year old who works selling articles of clothing, groceries and shoes. She offers these products at different markets, extends credit and then collects on a daily basis. Her nephew works with her and is in charge of the collecting. Leili has been a member of the community bank “Las Flores” for the past 5 years and she’s known for always paying her loans back on time. Her first loan was for 300 soles. She invested it in articles such as soap, laundry detergent, cheese and yogurt. With this loan of 2500 soles, she will purchase another motor bike since she needs it for the collecting from her customers. Her aim is to have her own stall where she can sell her products and continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of another motor bike that she needs for collecting from her customers

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
José Alfredo L. L. es un señor de 50 años, vecino de Los Tijos de Upala, localizado en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural  con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi montañosa ubicada en Costa Rica, Centroamérica.  La comunidad se dedica especialmente a la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería. Vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos.

Desde hace  varios años, don José Alfredo se ha desarrollado como microempresario, tiene un pequeño terreno en el cual  se dedica a la siembra de Ñampi, un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Costa Rica como en otros países. Dice que gracias a este proyecto ha aprendido mucho y también le ha dado oportunidad de desarrollarse personalmente y profesionalmente.

Actualmente don José Alfredo está solicitando un préstamo de ¢680,000 (seiscientos ochenta mil colones), para ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del ñampi. 

Con esta inversión espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto. Ya que desea realizar más proyectos en el futuro y también mejorar las condiciones de su familia.

Don José Alfredo forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Los Tijos, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  su quinto crédito y dice que con el espera seguir creciendo como microempresario y sacar su negocio adelante.
texts.en:
José Alfredo L. L. is a 50 year old man who lives in Los Tijos de Upala in Alajuela province. It is a rather widespread rural community with a semi-mountainous topography in Costa Rica, Central America. The community focuses on growing basic grain and on a small scale, livestock. He lives with his wife and two children. For the past few years José Alfredo has developed his business. He has a small plot of land where he grows Ñampi, a small tuber with a pleasant flavor, rich in nutrients, with wide agro-industrial application and is in great demand in Costa Rica as well as other countries. He says that thanks to this project he has learned a lot and it also has provided him the opportunity to develop himself personally and professionally. Today José Alfredo is seeking a loan for ¢680,000 colones to help prepare the farmland, buy seeds, fertilizers, and other items needed to guarantee a successful planting of ñampi. With this investment he hopes to have a good harvest, with products worthy of a high price. He would like to do more projects in the future and also improve his family’s living conditions. José Alfredo is a member of the Los Tijos Communal Credit Business, one of 100 EDESA member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be his fifth loan and he says that he hopes to continue growing his business and keep it moving forward successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy items to plant, grow, and harvest ñampi

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una socia dedicada  a su trabajo, optimista y con gran deseo de salir adelante, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida como Juanes(arroz envuelto en hojas), tacacho (plátano machacado), arroz chaufa, chuleta de chancho a la parrilla. Cuenta con el apoyo siempre de su esposo, cuyo trabajo es maestro de construcción. Nancy es una socia activa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Dulce Vida II”, desde hace dos años.  Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de insumos para la venta de comida. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 soles, piensa invertirlo en la implementación de su negocio de menús, comprará insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de sus alimentos.  La meta de Nancy  es construir un local donde funcione su restaurante  y seguir apoyando a su esposo en la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Invertirá en la implementación de su negocio ( venta de menús).

loans.name: Criss

texts.es:
Criss es una joven soltera, es mujer dinámica y trabajadora, tiene 21 años de edad, estudiante de educación inicial,  se dedica a la elaboración de flores, bisutería, y vende prendas de vestir, pues ella le ayuda a su tía  en este negocio. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Heroínas” desde hace cuatro años, ella empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles y lo invirtió en la compra de prendas de vestir. 
Con este préstamo de 1000 soles, comprará prendas vestir, materiales para elaborar flores y adornos del hogar, también invertirá en piedras para aumentar su bisutería. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda de prendas de vestir, calzados, carteras y adornos para el hogar.

loans.use: Comprará prendas vestir, materiales para  elaborar flores y adornos para el hogar. Comprará piedras de bisutería.

loans.name: Zoidolith

texts.es:
Zoidolith es una persona dinámica y extrovertida, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera de  dos hijos menores de edad, ella ha sabido salir adelante sola. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas , su pequeño negocio funciona en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su papá quien le ayuda a atender en su negocio. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “las Heroínas”, desde hace 5 años. Su primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la apertura de su negocio de venta de golosinas. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1400, comprará golosinas y también frutas. La meta de Zoidolith es poder llegar a tener una gran bodega bien surtida de productos.
texts.en:
Zoidolith is a dynamic and outgoing 31 year old single mother of two small children who has been a successful businesswoman. She sells candy. He small business is in her home and she relies on her father’s support to help take care of the business. She has been a part of the “Las Heroínas” (The Heroines) communal bank for 5 years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she invested in opening her candy business. With this loan for 1400 soles, she will buy candy and also fruit. Ziodolith’s goal is to be able to have a large well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy candy and fruit

loans.name: Lucerito De José Galvez Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: “LUCERITO D. JOSÉ GALVEZ” 

DesD. hace dos años y diez meses se formó la alcancía comunal “Lucerito D. José Galvez” en el AA.HH. San Antonio – Chosica, sus integrantes son personas que tuvieron que trabajar D. manera independiente debido a las diferentes circunstancias que atravesaban cada uno D. ellos. El grupo se dedica a vender: ropa D. manera ambulatoria, picarones (dulce), tejidos en lana y macramé, manualidades, crianza D. pollos, alquiler D. carro.
Ellos van en su noveno préstamo, durante este tiempo el dinero prestado les ha servido para implementar y mejorar su negocio.
Tal es el caso D. Gloria C. García quien es presidenta D. este grupo que desD. hace cuatro años se dedica a vender productos D. limpieza para el hogar, empezó con un pequeño capital lo cual compró en detergentes y desinfectantes; con el tiempo su negocio creció hoy en día venD. variedad D. productos D. limpieza, además con estas ganancias ha hecho una compra-venta D. un mototaxi pagándolo en letras mensuales. Ahora tiene mayores ingresos a lo que contaba antes, así ayuda en la preparación a sus dos menores hijos en una academia para que éstos puedan ingresar a la universidad. El préstamo reciente lo invertirá en mercadería (detergentes, desinfectantes y aromatizadores) que son productos D. mayor demanda por sus clientes. 
L. C. Cristina, tiene el cargo D. secretaria del grupo, es hija D. Gloria, al igual que su madre trabaja hace cuatro años en la venta D. ropa: uniforme D. colegios, polos, medias, bivirís. Este trabajo que tiene contribuye en darle una vida apropiada a su niñita D. cuatro años. Cristina invertirá en sandalias y polos con el dinero dado reciente.
texts.en:
“LUCERITO D. JOSÉ GALVEZ”

Two years and ten months ago, the “Lucerito D. José Galvez” Microfinance Institute was formed in AA.HH. San Antonio – Chosica. The group members are people who had to be self-employed due to the different hardships that they were facing. The group members sell: clothing as street vendors, picarones (pumpkin fritters covered with syrup), wool knitwear and macramé, handicrafts, live chickens, car rentals.

They are currently in their ninth loan cycle. During this time, their previous loans have helped them implement and improve their businesses.

Such is the case of Gloria C. García, the group president, who has been selling household cleaning products for the past 4 years. She started out with a little bit of capital and purchased detergents and disinfectants. As time passed, her business grew. She now sells a variety of cleaning products. Furthermore, with her profits, she has started to buy and sell motorcycle taxis, giving monthly payments. Her profits are now bigger than before, so she can help place her two youngest children in an academy so that they can enter a university in the future. She will invest this loan in merchandise (detergents, disinfectants, and room deodorizers). These are the products that her customers request the most.

L. C. Cristina, the group secretary, is Gloria’s daughter. Like her mother, she has also been in business—selling school uniforms, T-shirts, pantyhose, underwear—for 4 years. Her job contributes in providing her 4-year-old daughter with a decent living. Cristina will invest in purchasing sandals and T-shirts with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Santa Cruz De Ccechcca Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Santa Cruz D. Ccechcca, está ubicado en la Comunidad D. Santa Cruz D. Ccechcca, en el distrito D. Tambillo, provincia D. Huamanga, departamento D. Ayacucho.

Victoria, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, Victoria tiene una tienda en la comunidad donD. también venD. comidas, sus hijas le ayudan en su bodega, Victoria en algunos casos aprovecha las ferias locales para vender su comida. Solicita su préstamo para invertir en su bodega y en su restaurante.

Maruja, es conviviente, se dedica a la venta D. comida en su comunidad, su esposo le ayuda en su negocio, solicita su préstamo para implementar su pequeño kiosco D. comida. Su sueño es tener una chicharronería en Huamanga.
texts.en:
The Santa Cruz D. Ccechcca Communal Bank is located in the Santa Cruz neighborhood of Ccechcca, Tambillo district, Huamanga province, Ayacucho department. Victoria is married and has 4 children. Victoria has a store in the community where she also sells meals. Her children help her in the store. Victoria sometimes goes to the local market to sell her food. She is seeking a loan to invest in her store and in her restaurant. Maruja has a partner and sells prepared food in her community. Her husband helps her with the business. She seeks a loan to open a small food kiosk. Her dream is having a chicharronería (a small business that focuses on preparing chicharrón, which is fried pig skin or pork rinds) in Huamanga.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The 17 members seek loans to invest in their respective busiensses

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu R. es una mujer emprendedora y  dinámica, tiene 46 años, es madre de cuatro hijos mayores de edad, ellos trabajan junto a su mamá en el negocio, pues ella se dedica a preparar tortas y decorarlas, también hace Buffett para reuniones y agasajos.  Cuenta también con el apoyo de su esposo, él es chofer de ómnibus. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en ingredientes e insumos para decoración de tortas. 
Con este préstamo de 2000 soles, piensa comprar un motocarro que le facilitará el transporte de sus materiales de trabajo, y los productos que ofrece. La meta de Marilu es construir un local de recepciones, bien implementado donde pueda ofrecer sus productos a los clientes.
texts.en:
Marilu R. is a dynamic and hard-working woman. She is 46 years old and is the mother of four adult children who work alongside their mother in her business. She bakes cakes and decorates them. She provides buffets for parties and social events as well. She also gets help from her husband who is a bus driver. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she invested in ingredients and supplies for cake decorating. With this loan of 2000 soles, she hopes to buy a car to make it easier to transport her working materials and her final products to her clients. Marilu's goal is to build a well-designed reception hall where she can offer her products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a car to transport her products

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela es una persona activa, emprendedora que lucha por sus sueños, ella tiene 48 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, se dedica al negocio de preparación y decoración de tortas, buffet, también se dedica a la decoración de locales para fiestas. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él se dedica a la venta al por mayor artículos de ferretería. Adela pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Audaces”, desde hace 10 años. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en sus estudios de Decoración de tortas, buffet y locales. Actualmente ella requiere un préstamo de 1300 soles, lo cual invertirá en materiales como globos acrílicos, piletas decorativas para tortas, moldes de decoración.
texts.en:
Adela is a dynamic, enterprising woman who fights to realize her dreams. She is 48, and married with three grown children. She bakes and decorates cakes, and party puts together buffets, and also decorates venues for fiestas. Her husband, who is a hardware wholesaler, helps her. Adela has been with Banco Comunalthe “Mujeres Audaces” (daring women) Comunal Bank for 10 years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to study cake, buffet and venue decoration. She will use the money from this loan of, 1300 soles, to purchase articles like acrilycacrylic globes, cake displays, and decorative molds.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase articles like acrylic globes, cake displays, and decorative molds

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu I. es una persona trabajadora y entusiasta, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad y 1 hijo menor. Ella se dedica a preparar tortas y bocaditos para eventos especiales, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él  se dedica a manejar su motocarro . Marilu es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Águilas”, desde hace tres años, en donde ha demostrado ser una socia puntual en todo momento. El primer préstamo que recibió  fue de 300 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió para comprar materiales de decoración para tortas. 
Con este préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles, comprará otro motokar, ya que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Marilu I. is a hard-working and enthusiastic person. She is 44, the mother of 3, 2 of whom are adults and 1 is a minor. She works making sandwiches and appetizers for special events with the help of her husband. He drives her motokar. Marilu has been a member of the community bank “Las Aguilas for the last 3 years. She has shown herself to always be a punctual member. Her first loan was for 300 new soles, which she used to invest in the purchase of cake decorating supplies. With this 1200 loan of new soles, she will buy another motokar since that will allow her to increase her business .

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new motokar

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda  es  una persona colaboradora y dinámica, tiene 66 años de edad, tiene seis hijos  mayores de edad y profesionales. Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, tiene un pequeño negocio frente a su casa, ella es muy conocida por ser una persona atenta . Integra el Banco Comunal “ Las Águilas”  desde hace cinco años y siempre ha sido una socia puntual. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la apertura de su negocio actual. 
Con este crédito de S/. 1000 soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes, debido a que planifica aperturar una tienda de abarrotes con algunos productos básicos aptos para el consumo humano (arroz, azúcar, fideos, ,etc.). La meta de Florinda es tener una tienda bien surtida de productos y también tener una negocio de lubricentro, en esto va a trabajar con una de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Florinda is dynamic and helpful. She is 66, mother of 6 who are all adults and professionals. She works selling soft drinks and has a small business in front of her house. She is known as a courteous person. Part of the communal bank “Las Aguilas” for the past 5 years, her first loan was for 300 soles which she used to open her current business. With this loan of 1000 soles, she will invest in the purchase of groceries, since she plans to open a grocery store with some basic products for human consumption (rice, sugar, noodles, etc). Florinda’s goal is to have a well-stocked store and also to have an oil change shop where one of her daughters will work.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a supply of groceries

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, tiene 39 años de edad, esta divorciada de su esposo, es madre de familia de 4 hijos mayores de edad, todos  independientes, ellos la ayudan a seguir adelante. Se dedica a preparación y venta de juanes (arroz envuelto en hojas), ella vende sus productos en una empresa de transportes, también se dedica a vender prendas de vestir, para esto cuenta con el apoyo de una de sus hijas quien vende para ella. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Heroínas” desde hace 9 años, empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de insumos para vender comida. 
Este crédito de 1800 soles, piensa invertirlo en mercadería como son sábanas, toallas, edredones  y algunas prendas de vestir.  La meta de Reyna es tener un restaurante bien implementado .
texts.en:
Reyna is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial woman. She is 39 years old and is divorced from her husband. She is the mother of 4 adult children who are all independent from her and all help her out. Her business is making and selling juanes (rice wrapped in leaves). She sells her product at a bus company. She also sells clothing items with the help of one of her daughters, who sells them for her. She has been a member of the “Las Heroínas” communal bank for 9 years. She started with a loan of 300.00 PEN, which she invested in ingredients for the food she sells. This loan is for 1,800.00 PEN. She plans to invest it in merchandise such as sheets, towels, blankets, and some clothing items. Reyna’s goal is to have a well-run restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy sheets, towels, blankets, and some clothing items.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es una mujer carismática y trabajadora, tiene 62 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos (todos mayores de edad), la actividad que realiza es venta de productos regionales, tales como plátano, maíz, frejol regional, tapioca, ella ofrece estos productos en el puerto  de la ciudad de Pucallpa . Es socia del Banco Comunal “mujeres Audaces” desde hace seis años. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la apertura de su negocio. 
Hoy en día ella requiere de un préstamo de  1000 soles, pues invertirá en la compra de pescado seco, plátano, gallinas, fréjol, piñas . La  meta de Esther  es conseguir tener un kiosco en su domicilio .

loans.use: Invertirá en la compra de pescado seco, plátano, gallinas, frejol, piñas .

loans.name: Aïssatou Kafoye

texts.fr:
Aïssatou Kafoye B. est une femmes de 64 ans, elle est mariée et a un enfant en charge. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Kandialang Socé depuis 8 ans. Elle développe un petit périmètre maraîcher. Avec son prêt elle voudrait refaire son puits s'équiper en petits matériels agricoles pour mener à mieux son activité. 
Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aissatou Kafoye B. is a 64 year-old woman, she is married and she has one child in her care. She is a member of the community bank Kandialang Soce for the past 8 years. She keeps a small produce garden. With the loan she would like equip herself with gardening tools to better carry-out her work. She contributes to the improvement of her family's well-being.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase gardening tools.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Mitapasamana Group

texts.es:
El bancomunal Santa Rosa De Mitapasamana está ubicado en la Comunidad de Mitapasamana, en el distrito de Vinchos, Provincia de Huamanga en el departamento de Ayacucho.

La comunidad está en la zona altoandina a 50Km de la ciudad de Ayacucho, la vía es asfaltada, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura (cereales), ganadería (vacunos, ovinos).

Isabel, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos. Se dedica a la compra-venta de quesos y cereales. Isabel compra sus productos en las ferias y recorre los diferentes lugares donde hay cereales. Su familia le ayuda en su negocio. Isabel solicita su préstamo para incrementar su capital y para aumentar sus productos. Su sueño es mejorar sus ingresos para asegurar la educación de sus hijos.

Julia es divorciada, tiene 4 hijos, se dedica a la venta de queso y cereales, aprovecha las ferias locales para vender sus productos, recibe el apoyo de sus hijos para acopiar cereales. Julia solicita su préstamo para incrementar su capital, comprar más cantidad de queso y mas cereales. Su sueño es mejorar su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Los 12 socios solicitan su prestamo para invertir en sus negocios

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr: Alimatou C. est une femme de de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle achète et revend de l'huile de palme, elle fait la transformation et la vente de pâte d'arachide. Elle participe aux charges familiales pour 15000 francs CFA par mois. Elle voudrait renforcer ses capacités d'autofinancement et améliorer les condition de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Développer son activité de petit commerce

loans.name: Banna

texts.fr: Banna G. est une femme de 52 ans elle mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Tenghory depuis 4 ans et y a bénéficié de 8 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans problème. Elle vend des légumes au marché de son quartier et les bénéfices de son activité lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales et de prendre en charge la santé et la scolarité de ses enfants.

loans.use: Renforcer ses capacités d'autofinancement

loans.name: Khardiatou Alpha

texts.fr: Khardiatou Alpha D. est une femme mariée de 57 ans, elle a un enfant en charge. Elle a ouvert une petit cantine en hutte où elle vend divers produits alimentaires: pâte d'arachide, sucre, sel, oignon etc. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer aux différentes charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Khardiatou Alpha D. is a 57 year-old married woman who has one child in her care. She has opened a small cantine in a hut where she sells several food products, such as: peanut butter, sugar, salt. onions etc. Her earnings allow her to contribute towards various family expenses.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supplement her small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Ama  Adissou

texts.fr: A. Ama Adissou est une femme de 32 ans mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle habite à Lomé, une ville située à 120 kilomètres de Kpalimé. En cette période de rentrée scolaire et académique, Ama compte dégager un maximum de profit en faisant un prêt à la FECECAV. Ce prêt lui servira à acheter des fournitures scolaires comme : des cahiers, des bics, des crayons, des gommes, des livres,des ensembles géométriques etc.… pour revendre. Avec ces bénéfices, Ama compte envoyer ses enfants à l’école.
texts.en:
A. Ama Adissou, aged 32, is a married mother of three children. She lives in Lomé, a city located about 120 km from Kpalimé. During the current return-to-school season, Ama plans on earning a major profit by obtaining a FECECAV loan. This loan will be used to buy school supplies, such as notebooks, ink pens, pencils, erasers, books, geometry kits, etc…. for resale. With the profits, Ama intends to send her children to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy yams and corn

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en:
Lucio M. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 34 years-old and married with two school-aged children. Lucio owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Lucio is just starting his business.

In 2009, Lucio joined Kiva partner HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucio is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Marcializa

texts.en:
Marcializa A. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin. She is 32 years-old and married with three school-aged children. Marcializa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Marcializa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marcializa joined Kiva partner HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcializa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand the product offering. Marcializa is requesting a second loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

loans.name: Gombo

texts.en: Gombo is a very hard working person who is good at what he does. He lives with his wife and two university student children and who all help him with his vegetable planting and harvesting business. He started his business in 1995 with the help of his family. At the beginning they planted only small amounts of vegetables because of storage difficulties but as their business grew, they bought storage space to preserve the harvested vegetables. They plant all kinds of vegetables including potatoes, carrots and cabbage. Now they store approximately 40 tons of vegetables a year. After harvesting, they sell on the market for reasonable prices. In the future, he has a great desire to expand his planting area and produce quality vegetables that are good for people's health. This business is quite successful in the community. He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug (~1750 USD) loan in order to buy new machinery and to build an irrigation system which will make their business easier to manage.

loans.use: To buy machinery and an irrigation system

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn V. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 39 years-old and married with two school-aged children. Roselyn owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling rice products and viand in the local community. Roselyn has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Roselyn joined Kiva partner HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roselyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. Roselyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Betty Luz

texts.es:
Betty tiene 42 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su madre en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, ubicada a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al comercio mayorista de medias desde hace 5 años, ella adquiere su mercancía en la ciudad de Lima una vez por semana y luego la distribuye en los principales mercados de las ciudades de Trujillo, Piura y Bagua.

El negocio ha ido creciendo con el tiempo y por ello ahora vende medias para todo público, ocasionalmente también compra medias recién fabricadas y las manufactura para  luego distribuirlas. Esta actividad es la que le provee el sustento diario, además, de ella también depende el sustento de su madre que por ser de edad avanzada no puede trabajar.

Ella desea seguir ampliando su negocio con la compra de más medias para distribuir, por ello está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería para ampliar su negocio y seguir apoyando en el mantenimiento de su hogar.

Betty anhela otorgarle a su madre una mejor calidad de vida y ampliar su negocio para dar oportunidades de trabajo a sus familiares jóvenes. Ella es muy conocida por la zona, sus vecinos la consideran una mujer optimista y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Betty is 42 years old. She is not married and lives with her mother in the city of Ferrañafe, located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been in the business of selling socks for the past five years. She obtains her merchandise in the city of Lima once per week and then distributes it in the main markets in the cities of Trujillo, Piura, and Bagua. The business has been growing over time and so now she sells all sorts of socks. She occasionally also buys socks that have been recently made and embellishes them and then distributes them. This business is what provides her with a living. Her mother also depends on this business because she can’t work due to her advanced age. She wants to continue growing her business through buying more socks to distribute. To this end she is requesting a loan of 2,500.00 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. She plans to use to it to invest in the purchase of more merchandise so she can expand her business and continue to support her household. Betty wants very much to provide her mother with a higher quality of life and to expand her business so that she can give work opportunities to young family members. She is well-known in the neighborhood and her neighbors consider her an optimistic and hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy socks for re-sale.

loans.name: Hendresa

texts.en:
Hendresa E. is from the village of Catarman in Camiguin. She is 45 years old. Hendresa is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Hendresa makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Hendresa has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Hendresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hendresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Hendresa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Hendresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Kathy

texts.en:
Kathy B. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran inZamboanga del Sur. She is 25 years old. Kathy is married. To make a living, Kathy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Kathy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Kathy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kathy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Kathy is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Kathy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Juna

texts.en:
Juna P. is from the village of Maquilao, Tangub City in Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Juna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Juna raises and sells fish. Juna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Juna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juna is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Juna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Ninita

texts.en:
Ninita N. is from the village of San Jose in Camiguin. She is 50 years old. Ninita is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Ninita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Ninita has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ninita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ninita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Ninita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ninita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
