loans.name: Vilma Nery

texts.es:
La señora Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Porvenir” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 30 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 01 hijo, ella  estudio educación superior técnica completa, vive en el Barrio Santa Rosa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra lanas de diferentes colores. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 2200.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra la compra de abarrotes, gaseosas, golosinas, galletas, etc. Para su tienda.

Su deseo es tener una tienda de venta de lencería en Puno o Arequipa.
A ella le gusta la  puntualidad y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma is a partner in the Community Bank New Future which is located in the district of Puno, department of Puno. She is 30 years old, married, and has one son. She completed post-secondary technical studies. She now lives in the Santa Rosa neighborhood.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six years. Her initial loan was 300 new soles, money that she invested in her business buying different colored wools.

Now she is applying for a loan of 2200 new soles for the purchase of candy, soda, snacks, cookies, etc. for her shop.

Her wish is to have a shop that sells linens in Puno or Arequipa.

She likes being on time and attending the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of candy, soda, snacks, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Yeoung Khim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty two people who are all living in Svay Prey village in Kandal province is made up the village bank loan. Mrs. Yeoung K. is a village bank president who has been selected the members and they all will use the loan indifferent purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Chrin C., are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetable. With their vegetables growing, they face an obstacle because they do not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Yeoung K. decided to request a loan to buy vegetable seed and fertilizer to support her crop to make more productive. She is 49 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. All the members are presented on the picture but some of them are blocked.

Six members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy vegetable seed and fertilizer to support her crop to make more productive.

loans.name: Rosa Irene

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Porvenir” que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Puno, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 51 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 02 hijos, ella  estudio educación primaria completa, vive en el Barrio San Martín D. Porras. 

Inicia su trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. compra  venta D. quesos y carne, su negocio es una ves por semana en la feria D. los sábados. 

Su deseo es tener una tienda D. abarrotes.
A ella le gusta la  forma D. trabajo y las facilidades  que dan
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is a partner in the Community Bank New Future which is located in the district of Puno, in the Province of Puno, in the Department of Puno. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She completed primary school, and she lives in the San Martin D. Porras neighborhood. She began working with the Manuela Ramos Movement with an initial loan of 200 new soles, money that she invested in her business of buying and selling cheeses and meats. Her business is open once a week at the Saturday market. Inicia su trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. compra venta D. quesos y carne, su negocio es una ves por semana en la feria D. los sábados. Her wish is to have a convenience store. She likes her work and the terms of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheeses and meats

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosalía es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Porvenir” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 41 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y es madre de 01 hijo, ella  estudio educación primaria completa, vive en el Barrio Laykacota. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta  de carnes rojas. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra la compra de carnes rojas para vender en su puesto del mercado.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.
A ella le gustan las facilidades en los prestamos
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalia is a partner of the Community Bank New Future which is located in the district of Puno, Province of Puno, in the Department of Puno. She is 41 years old, married, and has one son. She finished primary school and lives in Barrio Laykacota.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years, her initial loan was 300 new soles, money that she invested in her business buying and selling red meat.

At this time she is applying for a loan of 500 new soles for the purchase of red meat to sell at her market stall.

Her wish is to continue working. She likes the terms of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of red meat

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia C.'s rice farm has been improving for many years. She has been helping her husband to till the wet field since the start of their marriage. The income she makes from growing rice is very beneficial in providing food, clothing, and other basic needs of her family.

She would like to expand her rice farm. She needs additional capital of Php 7,000 to grow more rice. This loan will truly help her pay for the equipment that she borrowed to prepare her land for planting and to pay the laborers who helped them plow the fields and transplant the seedlings.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Silvia Edith

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Porvenir” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 21 años de edad, estado civil soltera y no tiene  hijos, estudio educación superior universitaria incompleta, vive en el Barrio Manto Norte. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de carnes. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra la compra de carne de vacuno, ovino y de alpaca para vender en su puesto del mercado.

Su deseo es terminar su carrera y ejercerla.
A ella le gusta la  puntualidad y las reuniones donde comparte con sus compañeras
texts.en:
Silivia is a partner in the Community Bank, New Future, which is located in the district of Puno, province of Puno, department of Puno. She is 21 years old, single, and does not have children. She has studied at university, but has not completed her studies. She lives in the Manto Norte neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years, her initial loan was for 300 new soles, money that she invested in her business buying and selling meat. At this time she is applying for a loan of 1200 new soles for the purchase of beef, lamb, and alpaca meat to sell at her market stall. Her wish is to complete her degree and use it. She likes being on time and the meetings where she can share with her colleagues.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beef, lamb, and alpaca meat

loans.name: Mrs. Yim Khim Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eighteen people and they all live I. Svay Prey village I. Kandal province. Mrs. Yim K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. Yim K. is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she raises pigs. Since her business raising pigs is doing well, she wants T. expand it by purchasing more piglets T. raise.

Mrs. Yim K. is 47 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Mai Try, owns a business I. which uses rice T. make wine. 

Seven members I. this group loans have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with EoT loans are not required T. pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s maI. product because they are the most beneficial T. Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them T. repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able T.. Most clients start T. make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Amila

texts.en:
Amila L. started helping her husband grow rice last 2002. He has a 4-year old child that is her inspiration to pursue more in business. Currently, her family has a 1-hectare farm. Her dream is to make it prosper so that she could be able to give her child a college education that she never had when she was younger.

By availing loan of Php 5,000 she will be able to finace the needs in her business. The loan will able her to pay the laborers who helped them transplant the rice seedlings and toiled hard during land preparation. With this loan, Amila L. and her family, will be able to sustain their livelihood.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Gudilla

texts.en:
Gudilla S. is from the village of  Mambajao in Camiguin. She is 55 years old. Gudilla is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Gudilla owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Gudilla has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Gudilla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gudilla is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Gudilla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de San Isidro”, del  distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 28                      años de edad,  es madre soltera hace ya 3 años, tiene 2 hijos uno de 10 años y el otro de 4 años el padre de sus hijos lo abandono pero aveces manda algo para sus hijos ya que solo es obrero, ella tiene estudios de primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace   medio año, su primer préstamo fue de S/500.00 nuevos soles monto que le sirvió para adquirir mercadería en compra de diversas  frutas para poder venderlas en su triciclo y su lugar de venta  es el parque el cholo-Juliaca hace ya 4 años.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional S/ 500.00 nuevos soles con el préstamo ella podrá adquirir mas mercadería en frutas ya que ella realiza compra y venta de frutas.

Su mayor sueño en lo personal es tener su propia casa ya que ella vive alquilada hace 2 años. En el negocio es poner una jugueria de frutas y tener un buen capital y que sus hijos sean profesionales y no como ella.
Lo que le gusta de las reuniones de su banco comunal son los ahorros y las ganancias,  la facilidad del préstamo que se obtiene a comparación de otras instituciones donde los intereses no ganan y que son altas.
texts.en:
Ms. Elizabeth Y. is a member of the “Flor de San Isidro” Microfinance Institute in the Juliaca district of the San Román province, department of Puno. She is a 28-year-old woman who has been single for 3 years now. She has 2 children, a 10-year-old and a 4-year-old. The children’s father walked out on them, but he sometimes sends them some money because he is a laborer. She completed elementary school.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 6 months. Her first loan was in the amount of 500.00 PEN, which she used to obtain goods—assorted fruits—so that she can sell them on her urban delivery tricycle and at her usual spot in the Cholo-Juliaca Park, where she has been doing business for 4 years.

She currently needs an additional 500.00 PEN loan, with which she will be able to obtain more fruits for her business.

Her biggest personal dream is to have her own house because she has been renting for 2 years. Her business goals are to set up a juice bar and have enough capital. She also wants her children to become professionals and not be like her.

The things that she likes about her microfinance institute are the savings, the profits and the ease with which she can obtain a loan, compared to other institutes where interest is high and profits are low.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit

loans.name: Mrs. Rorn Choem Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of twenty people, is located in Srae Kaes village in Kandal province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Rorn C. is the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Yuon Vai, are farmers who owns 2.5-hectare (6.25-acre) field of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living.

With this plantation, they do not have enough money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field and they do not have rice seed yet. Thus, Mrs. Rorn C. decided to request a loan to pay for plowing and to buy rice seed to grow on the paddy field. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan.

Mrs. Rorn C. is 38 years old and is the mother of five children, two of whom are laborers while another two are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term (EoT) loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and to buy rice seed

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “Lucero del Amanecer”, del  distrito D. Juliaca, provincia D. San Román, departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 51                      años D. edad,  ella es casad y vive actualmente con su esposo, tiene 4 hijos solo uno  uno D. ellos vive con ella esto por motivos D. salud los otros ya trabajan y viven lejos D. ella, ella no tiene estudios pero esto no le impidió salir adelante y trabajar en todo ya que hace D. todo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace   muchos  años es una D. las fundadoras D. su Banco Comunal, su primer préstamo fue D. S/300.00 nuevos soles monto que le sirvió para adquirir mercadería para trabajos en tejidos D. artesanía como lana, hilos, etc.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional S/ 600.00 nuevos soles con el préstamo ella podrá adquirir mas mercadería en ferretería, también se dedica  en tejidos D. artesanía los cuales los lleva a Apurimac, Churin y los venD. al por mayor, en esta época D. año ella esta fabricando coronas ya que se aproxima el día D.  todos los santos  y las venderá al por mayor.

Su mayor sueño es equipar su tienda D. ferretería y aumentar su mercadería en cuanto a tejidos y llevarlos a otros lugares y venderlos al por mayor.

Lo que le gusta D. las reuniones D. su banco comunal son los encuentros entre las socias, la puntualidad.

loans.use: Para la compra de articulos de ferreteria.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana  es socia del Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, del  distrito D. Ilave, provincia el Callao, departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 60                      años D. edad,  ella es viuda hace 4 años, ella tiene 4 hijos  2 D. ellos tienen su pareja y 2 están solteros los culaes están a su lado, tiene estudios primarios completos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 11 años es una D. las fundadoras D. su Banco Comunal, su primer préstamo fue D. S/300.00 nuevos soles monto que le sirvió para invertir en la compra y venta D. carne y lana.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles con el préstamo ella podrá adquirir mas  productos D. carne y lana ya que ella se dedica a la venta y compra D. estos productos, ella compra estos productos es Mazo cruz, Ilave, a veces lo venD. al por mayor y la ganancia es poco pero mueve rápido el negocio.

Su mayor sueño es solo tener un buen capital y que su negocio crezca mas ya que la señora es D. edad avanzada y solo aspira a eso.

Lo que le gusta D. las reuniones D. su banco comunal son los encuentros entre las socias, las capacitaciones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana S. is a member of the “Micaela Bastidas” Microfinance Institute in the Ilave district of the Callao province, department of Puno. She is a 60-year-old woman who was widowed 4 years ago. She has 4 children, 2 of whom are married and 2 of whom are single and by her siD.. She completed elementary school.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 11 years. She is one of her communal bank’s founding members. Her first loan in the amount of 300.00 PEN was used to purchase and sell meat and wool.

She currently needs a loan for an additional 1,000.00 PEN, with which she can obtain more meat and wool to sell. She purchases these goods in Mazo Cruz, and sometimes sells them wholesale. Her profits are small, but her business is very active.

Her biggest dream is to have enough capital. She also hopes that her business will grow more. As she is elderly, those are her only aspirations.

What she likes about her microfinance institute’s meetings are being able to interact with her fellow group members, the training they receive, and their punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat and wool

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie E. and her husband, Edgar E., value the 1-hectare (~2.5-acre) rice field that they own, because it provides adequate food for the whole family. With 6 children to feed, hard work is required to make their farm productive. 

Less than a year ago, Melanie was able to qualify for membership in CEV. She immediately used the loan money for farm inputs. She said that ever since she became a member of CEV, her financing needs are met. 

Now she is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to be used for farm inputs. Melanie is very thankful for the financial support she receives for her business.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen E., age 39, lives on a farm with her husband and their 10-year-old adopted child. To finance their farm, they had borrowed money from financing groups that charge a high interest rate.

Helen is thankful that CEV accommodates farmers, because they really need the money to support their farm. When she became a member, she stopped borrowing from other individuals and financing groups. 

She has requested a loan of Php 10,000 to be used for farm inputs. Helen hopes she can save extra money for her child’s future with the low interest offered by CEV.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La señora YANETH  es socia del Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, del  distrito de Ilave, provincia el Callao, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 28  años de edad,  ella es soltera, y vive con su madre  tiene estudios   superiores completos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/300.00 nuevos soles monto que le sirvió para invertir en la compra y venta de ropas de bebe.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles con el préstamo ella podrá adquirir mas  mercadería en la compra de ropas de bebe y así implementar su puesto de venta, ella compra esta mercadería de Juliaca, Desaguadero y los vende en Ilave diariamente.

Su mayor sueño es que su negocio crezca más y tenga una mercadería surtida y que no le falte nada.

Lo que le gusta de las reuniones de su banco comunal es la puntualidad de las socias los ahorros y no le gusta las capacitaciones
texts.en:
Ms. Yaneth M. is a member of the “Micaela Bastidas” Microfinance Institute in the Ilave district of the Callao province, department of Puno. She is a 28-year-old single woman who lives with her mother. She has completed her post-secondary education.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 3 years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300.00 PEN, which she invested in purchasing and selling baby clothes.

She currently needs a loan for an additional 1,000.00 PEN, which will allow her to obtain more merchandise (baby clothes) and restock her sales stand. She purchases the merchandise in Juliaca and Desaguadero, then sells it in Ilave on a daily basis.

Her biggest dream is to see her business grow even more, to have a wide selection of merchandise, and never to lack anything.

What she likes about her microfinance institute’s meetings is her group members’ punctuality and the savings. She does not like the training.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase infant apparel

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites T. has been married to Bernie T. for 5 years. They are blessed with one child. She manages a sari-sari (variety) store, raises hogs, and along with her husband, tills their farm. She has been a member of CEV for almost a year now. Marites likes CEV’s financial services. Because of the lower interest charge, they are able to repay their loans. Now she is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 that she will use to finance their farm and their sari-sari store. She hopes to have a good harvest and use the income from their farm and store to support their family.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Mr. Kheam Kung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people who are all living in Kdei Ta Hok village in Kandal province is made up the village bank loan. Mr. Kheam K. is a village bank president who has been selected the members and they all will use the loan indifferent purposes. He is a dessert seller in the local village. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients for her current business. His wife, Mrs. PhA. Touch, helps him to sell the dessert.  Mr. Kheam K. is a father of a child who is a driver who can make a small salary to support the family. 

Nine members in this village bank loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more ingredients for her current business.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Maritza    es socia del Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, del  distrito de Ilave, provincia el Callao, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 26                      años de edad, es conviviente hace 6 años, ella tiene 1 hijo su pareja trabaja como mecánico, ella tiene estudio de superior incompleto.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/300.00 nuevos soles monto que le sirvió para adquirir cemento para techar su casa.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles con el préstamo ella podrá adquirir mas mercadería de calzados ya que se dedica a la venta de esto hace muchos años  los cuales los compra en Juliaca y Desaguadero y los vende cada domingo en Ilave.

Su mayor anhelo es convertirse en mayorista y así sus ingresos aumentarían, también pide siempre a Dios que su hijo sea un buen profesional.

Lo que le gusta de las reuniones de su banco comunal son las capacitaciones, los ahorros y no le gusta la impuntualidad.

loans.use: Para la compra de calsados

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn A., a mother of two children, is involved in a farming and hog-raising business. She used to borrow money at very high rates of interest, but since joining CEV less than a year ago, her borrowing costs have been lower, and she has used the money to buy farm necessities and pigs. She is grateful for how CEV has helped her whole family through its financial support of the business.

Jerlyn is now requesting a loan of Php12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy farming materials and feed for her hogs. This loan will help Jerlyn to grow her business.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Maritza    es socia del Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, del  distrito de Ilave, provincia el Callao, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 42                      años de edad, casada hace 25 años, ella tiene 2 hijo los cuales están a su amparo,  ella tiene estudio de secundaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 7 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/300.00 nuevos soles monto que le sirvió para la compra de ropa como medias, interiores, toallas, etc. ya que ella se dedicaba a la venta de estos productos.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional S/ 300.00 nuevos soles con el préstamo ella podrá adquirir mas mercadería en madejas de lana, ovillos de lana ya que actualmente ella se dedica  a la venta de lana los cuales los compra en Juliaca y los vende cada domingo en Ilave.

Su mayor anhelo es tener una tienda de lana y así estabilizar sus ingresos y tener mayor venta.

Lo que le gusta de las reuniones de su banco comunal son las capacitaciones, los ahorros y el encuentro con las socias, ella pide que se rebaje los intereses.

loans.use: Para la comp`ra de madejas de lana.

loans.name: Norie

texts.en: Norie M. owns a hectare of rice field in Trento, Agusan del Sur, and is also involved in food processing.  Married to Roger M., she is the mother of a five-year-old.  Having observed how CEVI has helped her fellow farmers, Norie decided she could also use help and readied herself to be a member.  She is now requesting a loan of Php5,000 for her farm and is grateful that she will not no longer have a problem with farm financing.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth Parreño has been married to Jonathan Parreño for 17 years now. She is 38 years old and has one child. Her family owns 3 hectares of rice fields, where they get the majority of their income. When it’s not harvest time, her family’s daily needs are met through Elizabeth’s income from doing manicures. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) because of the evident satisfaction she noticed among fellow farmers who availed of CEVI’s financial service. Elizabeth requested a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farming necessities. This loan will help her in maintaining her farm and hopefully will result in a rich harvest.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Andrelie

texts.en:
Andrelie A., a 29-year-old from Trento, Agusan del Sur, Philippines, started growing rice in 2006. She used her earnings to buy one hectare of rice fields. Her family’s daily needs are met through selling firewood as well. The majority of their income comes from the farm. She just recently joined CEVI; she was aware of the help it extends to farmers by attending the training and making herself a recipient of its financial assistance.

For starting, Andrelie requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to sustain her farm and also buy feed for the pigs. She is grateful she can pay the loan slowly because of the monthly amortization.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: 42-year-old Marilyn Dansalan resides in Trento, Agusan del Sur. She is a mother to 2 children. Their source of income is rice farming. Marilyn just recently joined CEVI. In need of additional financial assistance for their farm, she loaned Php4, 000, which will go to farming materials and equipments. She learned from fellow farmers that CEVI’s financial assistance truly is a helping hand and she hopes to experience the same.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Mrs. Samnang Noem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of thirteen people, is located I. Trapeang Ampil village I. Kandal province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Samnang N. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she raises pigs. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing four more piglets to raise.

Mrs. Samnang N. is 38 years old and the mother of four children who are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. S. Kly, owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice.

All the members I. this group loan have end-of-term (EoT) loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. EoT loans are AMK’s maI. product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy four more piglets to raise

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie Baguran is a new member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She is 33 years old and lives with her husband Julito Baguran and their 4 kids, the eldest being 14 years old. Apart from rice farming, Rosalie also sells banana que and clothes to make up for daily necessities.
Rosalie applied for a loan of Php5, 000 to buy farming materials and equipments. Having heard good feedback about CEVI from fellow farmers, Rosalie can only be thankful she joined for it is truly a big help in her farming.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
55-year-old Encarnacion E. is a rice farmer from Trento, Agusan del Sur, and has 4 children. She started farming in 2007. From this activity, her family’s daily needs were met. In need of additional capital for her farm, Encarnacion joined CEVI and is now on her first cycle.

She applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP, to be used to purchase farming necessities. Her loan will help sustain her farm, which is a major source of income for her family.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthou Sung Group Loan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthou S. is the group leader of four members who all live in Sdok Prei village in Kandal province. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Teb Phally, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. He also helps Mrs. Chanthou S.’s business.

Now, Mrs. Chanthou S. is applying a loan to buy a motorbike to transport the vegetables for selling. She is 29 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. 

One member in this group loan has an end-of-term (EoT) loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. The member with an EoT loan is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport her vegetables

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en: Restituta J. is 46 years old who lives in Tagbilaran City, Bohol with her husband and their 4 children. She is a fish vendor. One of her dreams in life is to send her children to school and hopefully be able to finance schooling until they graduate. Restituta is a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. Her previous loans went to fishnets and other fishing gears. Now she is applying for a loan of Php17, 000 to add to her capital. This loan will help Restituta and her husband in their fishing business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Aquila

texts.en:
Aquilia L. is 37 years old, is married and has four children. She is into a hog-raising business, which she hopes to make bigger. She is like any mother who wants her family to be happy.

A member of CEVI for more than a year now, Aquilia particularly likes the low interest rate. She is now requesting a loan of Php 8,000 which will be used to buy feed and piglets to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fish in bulk for her business

loans.name: Jeriebeth

texts.en:
Jeriebeth Q. is a rice farmer from Trento, Agusan del Sur, Philippines. She is 38 years old, now a widow and has 3 kids. Aside from farming, she also manages a small Sari-sari (variety/general) store where she sells viands. Jeriebeth is a new member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) and from what she knows, the organization could really help her in her business.
She applied for a loan of Php5, 000 that she plans to use for farming necessities. She believes that this loan could help her farming business, which in turn will ease their way of living.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en: Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Emmy M. from Mbeya. She is married with one child, 7 years old. Emmy has been running a business since 2008, purchasing and selling clothes. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and currently earns about 150 USD from her business. Emmy is requesting a loan in order to purchase clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open the same business at a new location. Emmy thanks you for your support! About SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Fatama Group

texts.en:
Fatama is the group leader of Fatama Group. There are three members in this group and they each want to take a loan to expand their business and make it larger. So they are requesting a group of loan 42,000 Afghani.

Fatama wants to take a loan for her business running a cart selling fruit.

Koko Jan wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store.

Saraya wants to take a loan for her husband who is a carpenter.

So they are all very thankful to Kiva lenders who are able to support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mr. Seu Lorng Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
Mr. Seu L. of the Mr. Seu L. Village Bank Loan Group lives in Kdei Ta Hok in Kandal province where he is president of the village bank. He has selected ten villagers to participate in the bank’s loan program, all of whom are using their loans for different purposes. Five members in this group have end-of-term loans while the rest have conventional loans requiring monthly payments.

Seu is a farmer who cultivates rice on his land. His wife, Mrs. Cheiv Breuch, is a weaver and pig breeder. Now she wants to expand her pig breeding business by purchasing more piglets. Mr. Seu L. is requesting a loan for this purpose.

About AMK:

End-of-term (EOT) loans are Angkor Microfinance Kampuchea's (AMK’s) main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the end of the loan’s term. It allows them, however, to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes

loans.name: Makhlasa Group

texts.en:
Makhlasa is the leader of the Makhlasa Group that is asking for a group loan. With her portion Makhlasa wishes to buy material for her embroidery and tailoring business. Khalasa wants to enlarge her husband’s general store, while Seyma needs capital to support her teaching.

Makhlasa is requesting a loan of 42000 AFN from Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company (AFS), a Kiva Field Partner for the members of the Makhlasa Group. They are very happy to be able to take advantage of this small-loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy material for her embroidery and tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase business capital

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 45 year-old Judy M. from Mbeya. She is a widow with five children between the ages of 17 and 28. Since 2000, Judy has been running a business purchasing and selling crops. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days a week and is assisted by two employees. Judy currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk. In the future, she plans to improve the quality of her business. Judy thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase bulk crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Amanallah Group

texts.en:
Amanallah, the leader of Amanallah Group, is married and has three children. With hard work he formed a group of four members, each one of them busy with different jobs. Amanallah has a metal-working business. H. has a general store, while Meir Ways has a tailoring shop. Pary Gull is in the carpet weaving business. Since they all wanted to build and expand their businesses, they formed the Amanallah Group so they could request a group loan. 

Each member of this group request the loan to further their work and be a good client for Kiva and AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company).

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her busuness

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Edina M. from Mbeya. She is married with four children between the ages of 7 and 20. Edina has been running a business purchasing and selling cereals since 1999. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and currently earns about 100 USD from her business. Edina is requesting a loan in order to purchase cereals in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open the same business at a new location. She thanks you for your support! About SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cereals in bulk

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 28 years old Farida M. from Mbeya. She is married  with 3 children, between the ages of 8 and 13. Farida has been running a crops business since 2007. Client’s business is purchasing and selling crops She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Farida currently earns about 110USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open the same business at new location. Farida thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her business

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a member of the Idope west in Kinayanambo, Iringa. She is married and she has 1 child. Her child is 3 years old.


Teresia has owned a food business selling local beer for 3 years,she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 70,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Teresia`s first loan from  BRAC_ Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for her business.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Teresia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for local beer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Sista

texts.en:
Sista is a member of the Idope west in Kinyanambo,Iringa. She is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 2 years old.

Sista has owned a clothing business selling clothes for 2 years, she works 12 hour a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Sisita`s first loans from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more used clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Sista hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena manages a mobile store business, selling vegetables, fruit and frozen fish. Her weekly net income is around PHP 6,000 and she uses most of it for the maintenance of her store. Aside from vending, she and her husband also have a two-hectare (5-acre) rice field managed by her husband as an additional source of income.

At present, Nena would like to request a loan of PHP 12,000 that she will use as additional capital to further develop her business. Her store has been a great provider for their family and so she wants to maintain it and make it grow.

Nena is married to Herminigildo, a farmer in their village. They are blessed with four children: Madonna - 21 years old, a working student; Heherson - 19 years old, a high school graduate who is now working as a farmer; Mylene - 15 years old, a fourth year high school student; and their youngest, Michelle - 13 years old, a grade 6 student. They live at Barangay La Paz, Cabatuan, Isabela, a rural place where residents live a very simple life.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a member of Mgodi North borrower group  in Kinayanambo, Iringa. She is 24 year old woman, she is married.

Teresia has owned a salon business for 2 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a  monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian  shillings.


This is Teresia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more Commodities for  her business.


With the  additional  profit she gains from the use of this loan, Teresia  hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials for her business

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is a member of the Mgodi borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is 24 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 7 and 4 years old.


Felista has owned a clothing business selling clothes for 2 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzanian shillings.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Felista hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more kanga  and vitenge

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en:
Anitha is a member of the Mgodi borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is 23 year old woman, she is Married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 5 and 3 years old.

Anitha has  owned a clothing business selling kanga and vitenge for 6 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is Anitha first`s loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more vitenge.


With the additional profits she gains from this loan, Anitha hopes to save money ,pay school fess and expand her  business.

loans.use: To buy more vienge for sale

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
41-year-old Asteria L. is a basket weaver from Bohol. She has four children. She wants to have additional capital for her business.

Being a member of CEVI for two years, its financing service has helped her family in a big way. Now, Asteria wants to apply for a loan of Php 8,000 to be used to buy additional materials for her basket-weaving business.

Aside from basket making, Asteria is also interested in venturing into another line of business. Receiving this loan will help her to grow her basket weaving and get started in a new business as well.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Elyorjon

texts.en: I. Elyorjon has been dedicated to cattle farming for the past two years and has vast experience in the field as it is the only business he is in. This work is satisfying and it enables him to purchase goods for his home and support his parents with household expenses. He provides the markets with meat and his family with necessary food. Elyorjon wants to buy young cattle and needs money so he decided to apply for a loan of 500 USD. He is counting on your help and expresses his gratitude for your generous heart. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
42-year-old Marcelina J. is a married woman who mothers eight children. Together with her husband, she ventured into a fish-vending and hog-raising business. Out of it were they able to build a small house and send their children to school. According to her, CEVI has played a big role in what they have achieved in life now.

Marcelina requested a loan of Php 15,000 to purchase additional pigs. She is hopeful that this loan will help her in maintaining their family business.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and feed and more fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the quality of her business

loans.name: Taman Satwa Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut Suarti (-) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Tuwed - Melaya. She is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Taman Satwa (DNR.M-0594). Ni Ketut Suarti is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month. In 2009, Ni Ketut Suarti joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her pigs. Ni Ketut Suarti is now requesting a new loan of 1,400,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her first from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni KetutSuarti - (-) merupakan 45 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Tuwed - Melaya. Ni KetutSuarti adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 11 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Taman Satwa (DNR.M-0594). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni KetutSuarti sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 8 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni KetutSuarti menghasilkan sekitar 0,500 IDR. Dalam 2009, Ni KetutSuarti bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni KetutSuarti telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1.000.000 IDR dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membangun tempat berteduh/kandang bagi ternak peminjam. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.400.000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan and her family live in Barangay La Paz, Cabatuan, Isabela. Susan's husband, Danilo, works in the Municipal Office of Cabatuan, Isabela. The couple have five children: Christian, 19, a third-year college student; Sony, 18, a second-year college student; Richmond, 15, a fourth-year high school student; Princess, 10, a grade 5 student, and Danica, 8, who is in grade 3.

Susan has been running a retail business for almost five years. In addition to managing her store, she also has a food processing business from which she can earn a weekly net income of 3,500 PHP. She uses this income as rolling capital for her store. A strong desire to achieve her dreams has motivated Susan to seek financial assistance from Kiva lenders. She would like to borrow 8,000 PHP to use as additional capital to expand her business. Susan believes that in order to achieve your goals in life, you should have patience and be industrious.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
This is Murad. He lives in Bagrami Kabul Afghanistan. He is 40, married with 3 children. 
He has got a general store in which he sells different kinds of things. He would like to expand his business and purchase the materials the demand of which is a lot in the market, so he has requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghani. 
He would like to thank Kiva from their great support.

loans.use: purchasing more materials

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a member of the Amani borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is 23 year old woman, she is married  and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 1 year old.

Suzan has owned a fruits business for 5 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 80,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Suzan`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 100,000 Tsh in order to buy more fruits like banana,oranges and sugarcane.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Suzan hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits

loans.name: Holida

texts.en:
J. Holida is 51 years old, married and the loving mother of two children. Holida is a cattle breeder. She buys small cattle at market for a low price, feeds them and then resells them on the same market at a more profitable price. Her elder son also works with her in this business. Holida works hard in order to make the business successful and able to generate a stable income for her family. Now Holida is planning to purchase more cattle to raise and sell. For this purpose she is requesting $700 USD. Holida would like to thank everyone for their support, and promises to manage the loan without violations or delinquency.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle for breeding and selling

loans.name: Ozodoy

texts.en:
Ozodoy is a happily married woman with four children. She has a friendly family who are always trying to help each other. Ozodoy is very hard-working and diligent, and takes pains to maintain economic stability within her home. She plants potatoes, onions and watermelon on her fertile crop land. Although losses from climate changes have often been substantial, she perseveres in her work because there have also been very profitable times. Ozodoy would like to acquire a larger quantity of chemical and natural fertilizers to raise the quality of her crops. She is counting on your help and thanks all of you sincerely.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
