She has been with Kiva partner LAPO Microfinance for more than a year. A. is asking for a loan of NGN 150,000 in order to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene

loans.name: Ndèye Sophie

texts.fr: Ndèye Sophie M. est une femme de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont un est à l'école. Elle est  membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE PLACE GAO depuis 6 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 13 prêts qu'elle rembourse toujours avec succès. Avec son prêt elle envisage de renforcer son activité de teinture afin d'accroître ses bénéfices qui lui permettront de participer aux charges et bien être familiale.
texts.en:
Ndèye Sophie M. is a 45-year-old married woman who is the mother of five children, one of whom is in school. She has been a member of Banc Villageois BOUCOTTE PLACE GAO for six and a half years and has received from it 13 loans, which she always repaid successfully.  With this loan, she envisions bolstering her business involving dyed cloth to grow her profits.  This will allow her to help with expenses and her family's welfare.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering and advancing her work

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Victoria Enríquez T. es socia del banco comunal el Paraíso, vive en Cumbe en el barrio 3 de Noviembre en la ciudad de Cuenca.  Ana  tiene 41 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 5 hijos de 24, 17, 14, 8, 6 y un nieto de tres años, su hijo mayor se encuentra viviendo en unión libre formando su propia familia, sus dos hijos de 17, 14 estudian en el colegio Cumbe, y los dos últimos estudian en la escuela Gabriel Arseminio Villauri de ese sector, no tiene casa propia por ello viven en casa de sus padres.

Ana se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos en su hogar  y algunos días de la semana a su negocio de comida,   los miércoles  trabaja vendiendo café con tamal o humitas, los sábados y domingos se dedica a la venta de salchipapas, nos dice que le va muy bien porque tiene su clientela fija.

Ana es socia de la fundación hace un año y le han ayudado mucho nos dice porque está generando su propio ingreso y saliendo adelante junto con sus hijos, el préstamo que la fundación le entrega lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando materia prima como (embutidos, papas, aceite, salsas, etc) y artículos desechables como tarrinas, fundas, sorbetes y muchos artículos más que necesita cuando solciitan el pedido  para llevar y le hacen falta en su pequeño negocio.

El sueño de Ana es ahorrar para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Ana Victoria Enríquez T. is a member of the Paraíso Communal Bank. She lives in Cumbe in the 3 de Noviembre neighborhool in the city of Cuenca. Ana is 41 and single. She has five children, 24, 17, 14, 8, and 6. She has a three year old grandson. Her oldest son lives with his significant other and has formed his own family. The 17 and 14 year old children go to school in Cumbe. The last two go to Gabriel Arseminio Villauri School in the area. She does not have her own house, so she lives in her parents’ house. Ana does the household chores, and some days of the week she works at her food business. On Wednesdays she sells coffee with tamales or “humitas” (a type of corn cake). On Saturdays and Sundays she sells “salchipapas” (food made from fried sausages and fried potatoes). It is going very well because she has steady customers. Ana has been a member of the foundation for one year. She tells us that they have helped her a lot because she is generating her own income and getting ahead together with her children. She will use the loan from the foundation to invest in her business and buy raw material like sausage, potatoes, oil, and salsa, etc. She will also buy disposable items like containers, casings, straws, and other items she needs for when they are asked for and she does not have them in her small business. Ana’s dream is to save to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for sausages, potatoes, oil, salsas, and disposable products like packages and straws, etc

loans.name: Ana Maruja

texts.es:
Ana Maruja M. Q. es una socia activa del banco comunal El Paraíso que encuentra ubicado en   la parroquia Cumbe a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca,  Ana vive en el sector de los Olivos a unos 15 minutos de la parroquia  Cumbe, tiene 40 años de edad vive en unión libre, tiene 2 hijos de 17, 9 años de edad, su hijo mayor estudia en el colegio Técnico Cumbe y su hijo pequeño estudia en la escuela Gabriel Arseminio Villauri del sector, su casa es  propia hecha con el esfuerzo de varios años de su juventud, su esposo es transportador de gas, se ayudan económicamente formando un buen pilar familiar. 

Ana tiene una  tienda de abarrotes hace unos 10 años y le va muy bien en su negocio, el horario de trabajo es desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche todos los días  sin cerrar los domingos, nos cuenta que la ventaja de trabajar en un negocio propio es que no está sujeta a un estricto horario y nadie que  le de órdenes, cuando tiene una ocupación cierra el negocio, su desventaja es que le falta un poco de capital para surtirle a su tienda. 

Se encuentra trabajando junto al bankito hace 10 ciclos, recuerda que cuando iniciaron eran solo 6 socias y ahora están 19 y espera  que más mujeres se integren para seguir creciendo.
Los prestamos le han beneficiado en su negocio, también le gusta porque se garantizan entre compañeras y no realizan mucho papeleo.

El dinero del crédito solicitado lo  invertirá  en su negocio comprando mercadería surtida para abastecer mejor y contar con un stock adecuado para ofrecer a sus clientes.

La meta de Ana  es  tener un mini comisariato, ponerse cabinas telefónicas y una papelería.
texts.en:
Ana Maruja M. Q. is an active member of the El Paraíso Communal Bank, which is located in the Cumbe parrish in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. Ana lives in the Los Olivos area, which is 15 minutes from the Cumbe parrish. She is 40 and in a common law marriage. She has two children, 17 and 9. Her older son goes to the Técnico Cumb School. Her younger son goes to the Gabriel Arseminio Villauri School in the area. Her house is her own, made with various years of effort in her youth. Her husband transports gas. They help each other economically, forming a good family cornerstone. Ana has had a grocery store for ten years. Her business is going very well. Her work hours are from six in the morning until ten at night every day, without closing on Sundays. She tells us that the advantage of working in your own business is that you are not subjected to a strict schedule, and nobody gives you orders. When you have something else to do, you close the business. The disadvantage is having little money to stock the store. She has been working with the bank for ten cycles. She remembers when they started and there were only six members. Now, there are 19. She hopes that more members join to keep growing. Her business has benefited from the loans. She also likes it because they guarantee them between colleagues, and they do not need to do much paperwork. She will use the money from the loan she is asking for to buy merchandise to better stock her store and have adequate stock to offer her customers. Ana’s goal is to have a mini supermarket with telephone booths and a stationery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to better stock her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Novatas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Novatas  está ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca,  es una ciudad muy hermosa siendo patrimonio cultural de la humanidad y,  la tercera ciudad más importante de Ecuador, su clima es frio  pero  el corazón de nuestra gente es muy cálido  pues son personas  muy amables y hospitalarias con propios y extraños.

Este banco está integrado por siete socias  que  son muy buenas amigas y conocidas de hace  muchos años que   se han  unido para formar su banco comunal  y  buscar la superación  personal y  tener una vida más  digna para ellas y sus familias,  las socias viven en diferentes partes céntricas de la ciudad de Cuenca; a continuación testimonios de la socias.

La señora María Isabel Q.  es  socia del banco comunal Las Novatas, vive dentro de la  zona urbana de la ciudad de Cuenca; María Isabel tiene 40 años de edad y ha concebido 4 hijos de 22, 21, 16, 8 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independientemente con su familia, su segundo hijo estudia en el CEDEC y trabaja para sus gastos personales, sus otros dos hijos aun están en primaria y secundaria. El  esposo de María Isabel emigro al exterior  y les envía dinero para solventar en algo los  gastos de la casa, no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando.

María Isabel se dedica  a  la crianza  de pollos, lleva trabajando 2 años en esta actividad y le va muy bien,  nos cuenta que con su negocio paga las deudas y con las pocas ganancias que obtiene incrementa su negocio para así hacerle más fructífero.

Este es su tercer  ciclo trabajando junto a su banco comunal y le agrada mucho todos los beneficios que obtiene. 

Con el préstamo obtenido  va a comprar más crías, comida y vitaminas para  sus pollos e ir incrementando su negocio.

El sueño de María Isabel es tener su casa propia para darles tranquilidad a sus hijos.

La señora Rosa María M. P. es una de las socias más alegres  del banco Comunal las Novatas,  Rosa vive en la zona urbana de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 39 años de edad,  está casada y fruto de su amor procreo 6 hijos de 25, 22, 20, 18, 15, 13 años de edad, sus dos  primeros hijos están  casados y formaron su propia familia; sus 4 hijos menores estudian  y trabajan para sus gastos;  su esposo emigro al exterior  y debido a la crisis mundial que existe les envía dinero solo cuando puede, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Rosa se dedica a la crianza de pollos lleva tres años en el negocio y le va muy bien porque tiene entregas a clientes fijos y cuando tiene tiempo trabaja en el taller de tapicería de su hijo.

Es su tercer ciclo junto a la Fundación Espoir, está muy orgullosa de la superación que ha obtenido gracias a los créditos obtenidos. Con el préstamo  que  la fundación le entrega lo va ha invertir en la compra y alimento de pollos por que desea ampliar su negocio.

Su sueño es  tener un negocio de venta de madera y ampliar su negocio de pollos para darles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
La señora Lourdes  de la Nube Zhispun P. es socia del Bankito Comunal las Novatas, ella vive en  el sector de Medio Ejido una  zona urbana de la Ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra felizmente casada, tiene 29 años de edad y 4, y se encuentra embarazada de tres meses de su quinto hijo, nos cuenta que este embarazo le está dando un poco de complicaciones por lo que tiene que estar un mayor tiempo en repos;  vive arrendando, su esposo trabaja en una tapicería y forman una familia estable.

Lourdes trabaja en un gabinete de belleza de su propiedad, es muy conocedora de los cortes y peinados que se encuentran a la moda, por que trabaja en esta rama de la belleza desde que tenía 14 años de edad, ya son 12 años de experiencia, tiene su propia clientela, trabaja en su negocio propio hace 7 meses por que se compro el local.

 Este es su tercer crédito en la fundación y se encuentra muy contenta porque con el dinero que la fundación le presta paga las letras de su local y adquiere más productos para llenar su vitrina con productos de belleza.

Su meta es de ampliar su local de belleza y abrir otras sucursales.
texts.en:
The Las Novatas Communal Bank is located in the city of Cuenca. It is a very beautiful city, being the cultural heritage of humanity. It is the third most important city in Ecuador. Its climate is cold, but the heart of our people is very warm. They are kind and hospitable people with their own and with strangers. This bank is make up of seven members who are very good friends. They have known each other for years, and they have united to form a communal bank, look for self improvement, and have a more decent life for themselves and their families. The members live in different central parts of the city of Cuenca. Following are their statements. María Isabel Q. is a member of the Las Novatas Communal Bank. She lives in the urban region of the city of Cuenca. María Isabel is 40; and she has four children, 22, 21, 16, and 8. Her first child is married and lives independently with his family. Her second child studies at CEDEC, and he works for his personal expenses. The other two children are in elementary and high school. María Isabel’s husband emigrated to the exterior, and he sends them money to pay some of the household expenses. They do not have their own house; they rent. María Isabel raises chickens. She has been doing this for two years, and it is going very well. She tells us that with her business she pays debts. With the small earnings that she gets, she increases her business to make it more productive. This is her third cycle working with her communal bank. She is very grateful for all of the benefits she has. With the loan received she will buy more chicks, food, and vitamins for her chickens, and increase her business. María Isabel’s dream is to have her own house to give her children tranquility. Rosa María M. P. is one of the happiest members of the Novatas Communal Bank. She lives in the urban region of the city of Cuenca. She is 39, married, and has six children. They are 25, 22, 20, 18, 15, and 13. Her first two children are married and have their own families. The four youngest children go to school and work for their expenses. Her husband emigrated to the exterior. Due to the world crisis, he sends them money only when he can. She does not have her own house; she rents. Rosa raises chickens. She has had the business for three years, and it is going very well because she has orders from fixed customers. When she has time, she works in her son’s upholstery shop. This is her third cycle with the Fundación Espor. She is very proud of the improvement she has made thanks to the loans she received. With the loan from the Foundation she will buy food for the chickens because she wants to expand the business. Her dream is to have a business selling wood and to expand her chicken business to give her children a better future. Lourdes de la Nube Zhispun P. is a member of the Novatas Communal Bank. She lives in the Medio Ejido area, an urban region of the city of Cuenca. She is happily married, 29, and she has four children. She is three months pregnant with her fifth child. She tells us that this pregnancy is giving her some complications, and she has to spend more time resting. She lives in a rented house. Her husband works in an upholstery shop. They are a stable family. Lourdes works in her own beauty station. She knows a lot about cuts and styles that are in fashion because she has worked in this area of beauty for 14 years. She has 12 years of experience. She has her own customers. She has worked in her own business for seven months because she bought the place. This is her third loan with the Foundation. She is very happy because the money the Foundation loans her pays for the installments on her place. She also gets more beauty products to put in her showcase. Her goal is to expand her beauty location and open other branches.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens, vitamins and food to raise them, and to expand their businesses

loans.name: Maria Gudela

texts.es:
La señora María Gudela P. O. es socia del banco Comunal  El Paraíso, María vive en El Amarillo, comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia Cumbe en la ciudad de Cuenca, ella tiene 61 años  y está casada,  concibió 3 hijos de 41, 30, 27 años de edad, todos sus hijos se encuentran casados y uno de ellos está en el extranjero, vive en casa propia que la construyo junto a su esposo cuando estaba con salud, su esposo tuvo un accidente de tránsito y se fracturo la pierna en dos partes y ahora ya no puede trabajar.

María Gudela tiene un negocio de ganado vacuno los compra pequeños para tenerlos un tiempo los alimenta y los vende, también compra ganado grande para la venta entre la semana que hay ferias, nos cuenta que ahora casi solo sale para la comida por que no existe mucha ganancia.

Ella trabaja con la fundación hace cinco años y es una de las socias fundadoras de su bankito comunal. Los préstamos anteriores le han ayudado para la compra de su ganado y también para la compra de medicamento para su esposo.

Con el préstamo solicitado a  la fundación va  a comprar más ganado para seguir incrementando su corral de animales; así como tambien la compra de vitaminas y comida para su crecimiento.

El  sueño de María Gudela es que la fundación le siga apoyando con los créditos para tener un mejor nivel de vida para ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
María is a member of the El Paraíso Village Bank and lives in the El Amarillo community of Cuenca city. She is 61 years old, married, and has three children ages 41, 30, and 27. All of them are married and one lives abroad. She lives in her own house that she constructed with her husband back when he was healthy, before he suffered a road accident resulting in a leg fracture in two places and prohibiting him from working.

María has a cattle business involving the purchase of small cattle, which she feeds and then sells. She also buys larger cattle to sell during the week of fairs.

She has been working with the foundation for five years and is one of the founding members of her community bank. Her former loans have helped her buy cattle and also medicine for her husband.

With the loan she requests she will buy more cattle to continue increasing her corral of animals; she will also buy vitamins and food for their growth.

María’s dream is for the foundation to keep supporting her with loans so that she can increase the quality of life for her and her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cattle, food, and vitamins

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es chofer propietario de un taxi que trabaja en la línea del trufi 88 del sindicato Eduardo Abaroa, grupo  Correcaminos, trabaja como servicio de transporte publico interciudad La Paz - El Alto. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus  cuatro hijos que depende de él; es casado y su esposa no cuenta con un trabajo. Vive en alquiler ubicada en la Zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para el arreglo de su movilidad y así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Juan.
texts.en:
Juan is the owner and driver of a taxi who works in the trufi 88 line of the Eduardo Albaroa labor union. He works providing public transportation between La Paz and El Alto. This work is his main source of income and helps him support his four dependent children. He is married and his wife is does not work. They live in a rented house in the Tembladerami Zone in La Paz city.

The loan he requests will go towards the repair of his auto so that he can increase his income.

An evaluation by IMPRO approved Juan for this solicitation of his first loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan trabaja como transportista publico interprovincial, la esposa es productora de leche de vaca, misma que  comercializa en la ciudad de La Paz, constituyendose esta actividad en su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus dos pequeños hijos de 1 y 3 años de edad. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la comunidad Villandrani a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto. 

El crédito lo destinará para comprar una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para poder producir mayor cantidad de leche.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado por Juan.
texts.en:
Juan works as a provider of interprovincial public transportation. His wife is a producer of cow’s milk, which is commercialized in the city of La Paz. Both of these activities make up their principal source of income used to support their one-year-old and three-year-old. The family lives in Juan’s parent’s house located in the Villandrani community two hours away from the city of El Alto.

The loan he requests will go towards the purchase of a dairy cow of moderate quality so that they can produce a greater amount of milk.

An evaluation by IMPRO approved Juan for this solicitation of his first loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 39 years-old and married with four children. In order to make a living, Stella sells food items such as garri (a food made from cassava tubers) in her shop. She is requesting a loan of NGN 140,000 in order to purchase more food items to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food items

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
Anastasio es productor de leche de vaca, misma que  comercializa a la empresa PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con  que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos. Vive en la comunidad de Achacachi, Provincia Omasuyos ( a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinará para comprar alimentos (Forraje) para los ganados que producen leche.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por el cliente.
texts.en:
Anastasio works in a dairy producing milk that is sold by PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche). This business is his primary source of income to cover the household expenses of his three children. He lives in the community of Achacachi, in the province of Omasuyos, three hours away from the city of La Paz. He will use the loan to buy fodder for the milk cows. This is his third loan with Impro whose evaluation process has approved the loan requested by Anastasio.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fodder for milk cows

loans.name: Odimafo Nti Group

texts.en: Veronica is forty-five years old and married with seven children, who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Veronica is a food vendor. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Odimafo nti’, meaning "because of the redeemer". The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes travel to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Hamidou Konaté est un homme de 35 ans, père de 2 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille monogame dans le  quartier populaire de Dougounina de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, très vite il commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la  vente de divers articles de boutique.
 Avec plus de 10 ans d’expérience dans cette activité, Monsieur Hamidou Konaté maîtrise bien  son activité, est apprécié et sollicité au niveau de tout le quartier. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son père.
 En vue d’obtenir une ressource financière complémentaire indispensable à l’épanouissement de ses activités, Monsieur Hamidou Konaté décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec laquelle, il est à son premier prêt pour acheter d’importante quantités d’articles divers pour sa boutique.  Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique, à une clientèle composée de  toute la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Hamidou Konaté compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA. 
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage agrandir sa boutique, payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Hamidou Konaté, 35, is the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in a monogamous family in the working-class neighborhood of Dougounina in the town of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended school, he began earning his living very early, mainly by selling various dry goods. With more than 10 years of experience in this business, he is very good at it and is appreciated and sought after in his community. He learned this business from his father.

In view of obtaining complementary financial resources which are indispensible if Mr. Hamidou Konaté wants his business to flourish, he decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his first loan, intending to buy a lot of articles for his shop. He does his buying in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) and sells his goods out of his shop, to a clientele composed of local people. With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA. With the profit, he counts on enlarging his shop, paying the interest on the loan, and supporting his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for his shop

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.en:
44-year-old Margueritte M., a widow, has two children aged 19 and 16. She lives in Nyarugenge in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Margueritte owns a small shop where she sells different kind of foodstuffs such as beans and rice. She opens her shop everyday from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.

Before requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company Margueritte was not able to get more food for her family. With this loan she has requested she believes she will earn extra profits which will help her to feed her children and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Mrs. Veronica G.'s mission in life is to be a loving, responsible and dedicated mother who aims to help her husband and family out of poverty. She lives in the village of Brgy. Mabini, Valladolid, Negros Occidental, with her loving husband, Mr. Judy G., who is a farmer and also an elected Brgy. Councilor in their village. Veronica is now 47 years old and her two sons are 18 and 20 years old. Her oldest son is gainfully employed while the younger is presently attending college.

Veronica is a successful entrepreneur who is always looking for good investing opportunities that will earn additional income. In her efforts to earn more income for her family, Veronica G. operates a general store and a cafeteria in their community, and also has a one-hectare rice field which is being farmed by her husband. Their combined business opportunities earn them a monthly income of approximately $215, which helps pay for the support of the family, her son's tuition, her weekly loan repayment and some savings for the future.

In the four years that she has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been able to maintain a good credit record by paying her installments on time, and to fully repay the loan within the promised period of time. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 was applied to her business and she paid it all on time without any delinquency. For her 9th loan cycle, she is again borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she can stock her general store with more goods to resell to her customers. She plans to use the profits from this venture to support the needs of her family.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Diaminatou

texts.fr:
Madame Diaminatou Samaké est âgée de 35 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 3 enfants en location avec d’autres ménages dans le quartier Médine de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Pour des raisons sociales, elle abandonna les études (en classe  de 6ème année fondamentale, système éducatif malien) de pour se mariage. Elle commença alors les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa grande sœur très habile dans le commerce d’articles divers. Elle travailla quelques années avec dernière qui lui  donnait de  petits articles à  revendre, quand elle revenait de ses voyages d’affaire de Lomé, Accra, Abidjan etc. Après ces quelques années d’initiation, Diaminatou opte pour le commerce d’habits, de sacs à main et de chaussures depuis maintenant 4 ans. Elle jouit d’une  grande réputation surtout auprès d’une franche de la population ayant un goût prononcé pour les articles de grands standings.
Dans l’optique d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait recours au programme crédit de  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière, depuis 12 mois après un 1er prêt individuel correctement bien remboursé. 
Elle est à son 2ème prêt qui servira à acheter, 12 complets de bazins riches. Elle s’approvisionne très généralement sur place à Ségou et souvent à Bamako.(capitale du Mali). Madame  Diaminatou  Samaké vend au comptant et à crédit à une vaste clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, elle  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA, ce qui lui permettra de faire face à  certaines charges familiales. 
Son ambition est d’acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation pour quitter la location.
texts.en:
Mrs. Diaminatou Samaké, 35, lives with her husband and their 3 children in rented quarters together with other households in the Médine neighborhood of the town of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For socio-economic reasons, she left school after the 7th grade, Malian education system, to get married. She began earning her living together with her older sister who was very good at selling various goods. She worked for several years with her sister who would give her little things to re-sell when she came back from her business trips to Lomé, Accra, Abidjan, etc. After these years of learning to the business, Diaminatou opted for selling clothing, handbags, and shoes, which she has been doing for 4 years. She has a good reputation, especially with folks who dearly want to have fancy things.

In view of growing her working capital so as to respond to the demand of her clientele, she turned to the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has been working with the latter for 12 months and reimbursed her first individual loan correctly. She is on her second loan which will be used to buy 12 outfits of expensive “bazin”. She generally does her buying right there in Segou and often in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). She sells for cash and credit to a wide clientele composed of men and women. With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 60,000 F CFA which will allow her to deal with certain family expenses.

Her ambition is to buy a plot of land to build a home on so that they will not have to rent anymore.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Massan Kake

texts.fr: Massan Kake G. est une femme de 42 ans qui habite qui habite à Dafo avec son mari et ses 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse d’oignons. Son activité consiste à s’approvisionner à Lomé et de revendre ses marchandises dans les marchés environnants. Avec les bénéfices de son activité Massan souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Massan Kake G. is a lady aged 42 who lives in Dafo with her husband and her four children. She is an onion retailer. She gets her supplies from Lomé and sells them at nearby markets. Massan wants to use the profit from her business to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy onions for resale

loans.name: Fadimata Sidi

texts.fr:
Madame  Fadimata Sidi K.  est âgée de 38 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 7 enfants en location avec d’autres ménages dans le quartier Hamdallaye B de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons familiales (puisque appartenant à une famille de pêcheur toujours en transhumance), elle commença très tôt le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait les poissons que pêchait son père. En plus de la vente du poisson sous toutes ses formes, frais, fumés et séché ; elle vendait également des fruits et légumes tels la mangue, les agrumes etc. Toujours soucieuse de diversifier ses activités, Fadimata ajoute une autre activité à son arc en entamant  la fabrication de glace alimentaire et de jus à base de fruits et d’arômes artificiels depuis maintenant 7 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle composée de toutes les catégories.
Dans l’optique d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a  fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son 1er prêt individuel.
Ce prêt servira à acheter, 1 congélateur. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou.  Fadimata Sidi K. effectue ses  ventes au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000FCFA,qui lui permettra de faire de l’embouche bovine et ovine, de payer des habits et  des médicaments pour elle et ses enfants. 
Son ambition est de construire une maison pour enfin quitter la location.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fadimata Sidi K., 38, lives with her husband and her 7 children in rented quarters together with other households in the Hamdallaye B neighborhood of the town of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Never having attended school due to family reasons (she belonged to a family of fishermen who were always following good fishing sites), she began very early on to earn her living together with her mother who sold the fish her father caught. Besides selling fish in all its forms (fresh, smoked and dried), she also sold fruit and vegetables such as mangoes, citrus fruit, etc. Always eager to diversify her business, Fadimata added another branch, beginning to sell food-grade ice and juice made of fruit and of artificial flavoring. She has been doing that for 7 years now and has a wide clientele from all walks of life.

In view of growing her working capital so as to respond to the demand of her clientele, she turned to the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom she is on her first individual loan. This loan will be used to buy a freezer. She does her buying right there in Segou. She sells for cash and credit to a clientele composed of men and women. With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 90,000 F CFA which will allow her to fatten cattle and sheep and pay for clothing and medicine for herself and her children.

Her ambition is to build a home so that they will finally not have to rent any more.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying a freezer

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
Deisy es comerciante de productos de Herba libe, es su fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos que depende de ella; los menores todavía se encuentran estudiando. Ella es divorciada y no cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, vive en anticretico ubicado en la Zona Ciudad Satelite de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de mercadería (productos balanceados dietéticos) y así poder vender más y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Daisy is a salesperson for Herbalife products. This is her source of income to cover the expenses of her two sons who are dependent on her, as they are minor children who are still in school. She is divorced, and does not receive help from her ex-husband. She lives in a leased home located in the Ciudad Satelite area of the City of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise (nutritionally balanced diet products) with which she can increase her sales and improve her income. This is her second loan with IMPRO, which has conducted an evaluation that has qualified her for the approval of the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase nutritionally balanced diet products from the firm Herbalife, for which she is an authorized vendor

loans.name: Djiguifa Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du  groupe Djignèyé Djiguiyé sont toutes mariées avec en moyenne 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivant dans des familles monogames dans le quartier Bagadadji et dans le camp militaire de la ville Ségou (4ème  Région administrative  de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers le service militaire de leurs maris et dans l’association traditionnelle entraide des femmes du camp militaire. Elles ont comme activités génératrices de revenus entre autres les ventes de pagnes wax, de tissus brodés, des produits maraîchers, de la glace, des pagnes tissés et des jus locaux d’oseille de Guinée et de gingembre. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont adhéré au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 7ème   prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les six précédents.
Ce montant sera utilisé pour acheter : 100 pièces de pagnes wax et une quantité importante de produits maraîchers (concombre, melon, oignon,…). 
Elles se ravitaillent en marchandises au Burkina Faso, à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et à la foire hebdomadaire au grand marché de Ségou et  revendent toutes leurs marchandises en détail, à crédit ou au comptant à domicile, en ambulant dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  participer aux évènements sociaux (mariage, baptême et décès). 
Elles ont pour ambition de devenir grossistes  dans la vente de pagnes wax.
texts.en:
The six women of the group Djignèyé Djiguiyé are all married and average 37 years of age and 4 children. They live in monogamous families in the Bagadadji district in the military camp of the city of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through their husbands’ military service and in the traditional women’s mutual aid association of the camp. Their revenue-generating businesses include selling Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), embroidered fabrics, market-garden produce, ice cream, woven pagnes, and local juices made from hibiscus flowers and ginger. With the goal of increase their working capital, the group members have joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their seventh solidarity loan, after having properly repaid the six previous ones. The loan will be used to buy: 100 bolts of Wax pagnes and a major quantity of market-garden produce (cucumbers, melons, onions,…) The merchandise is gotten in Burkina Faso, in Bamako (capital of Mali), and at the weekly fair at the grand marketplace of Ségou. It is sold entirely at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, at the house and by hawking it in the districts. The customers are composed of men and women. The group members plan on realizing an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to help with societal events (marriages, baptisms, and deaths). Their ambition is to become wholesale merchants selling Wax pagnes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and farm produce

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel  es una persona  muy trabajadora, ella tiene 43 años de edad, es madre de siete hijos, todos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, pues tiene un restaurante en el mercado número uno de la ciudad de Pucallpa, allí trabaja con algunas de sus hijas, ella empezó a vender sus menús (alimnetos)en una mesa, ahora es propietaria de un restaurante. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él es supervisor de una empresa. Ysabel es socia desde hace dos años del Banco Comunal “Dulce Vida II”, su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la apertura de su negocio. 
Con este crédito es de 1700 soles,comprará diversos productos e ingredientes para su restaurante, también comprará manteles para sus mesas. La meta de Ysabel es poder tener otro restaurante, pero quisiera construir este local en su casa y también seguir ayudando a su esposo.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a very hardworking person. She is 43 years old and is the mother of seven children, all of whom are grown up. She sells food for a living and has a restaurant in the number one market in the city of Pucallpa, where she works with some of her daughters. She began selling her food at a table, and now she is the owner of a restaurant. However, she counts on the support of her husband, who is the supervisor of a company. Ysabel has been a partner of the Banco Communal "Dulce Vida II" for two years. Her first loan was 300 soles, which she invested in the opening of her business. With this credit of 1,700 soles, she will buy diverse products and ingredients for her restaurant and will also buy tablecloths for her tables. Ysabel's goal is to be able to have another restaurant, but she would like to set up this business in her house and also continue helping her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy food products for her restaurant and tablecloths for the tables.

loans.name: Anllela

texts.es:
Anllela  es una socia colaboradora y entusiasta en su grupo, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de un niño, ella se dedica a la venta  de gaseosas, chupetes y hielo, esto lo realiza en su misma casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él administra una discoteca. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Dulce Vida” desde hace hace dos años, su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la apertura de su actual negocio. 
Con este crédito de S/ 2,300 soles, piensa comprar un motokar para así tener otra fuente de ingreso en su hogar y poder lograr tener otro negocio en su casa. La  meta de Anllela es tener un local propio como una fuente de soda  y así ofrecer una variedad de refrescos, gaseosas, cremoladas  y  otras bebidas.
texts.en:
Anllela is a helpful and enthusiastic member in her group, is 30 years old, and is mother to a young child. She makes a living selling carbonated beverages, lollipops, and ice from her home with the help of her husband who manages a night club. She has been a member of the Communal Bank "Dulce Vida" for two years. Her first loan was for PEN 300 which she invested in the opening of her current business. With this PEN 2,300 loan, Anllela plans to purchase a motokar (motorized rickshaw) so that she can have another source of income in her home and be able to have another business. Anllela's goal is to own a place where she can offer a variety of refreshments, carbonated beverages, iced desserts, and other drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a motokar

loans.name: Gemima Joyce

texts.es: Gemima es una mujer extrovertida y colaboradora, de 28 años de edad, tiene un hijo de un año de edad, es madre soltera, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes que funciona en su domicilio y tiene muchos clientes ya que da buen trato. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Flores” desde hace dos años, y siempre es puntual en sus cuotas. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de  300 soles, monto que invirtió en golosinas para vender. Con este préstamo de 1500 soles, lo cual invertirá en la compra de productos para su tienda como golosinas, bebidas, fideos, azúcar, etc. La meta de Gemima es agrandar su negocioya que es pequeña ,vender todo tipo de artículos para regalo y seguir trabajando por su niño para brindarle la mejor educación.
texts.en:
Germina is an extroverted woman who is a good collaborator. She is 28 years old. She has a one year old son and is a single mother. She has a grocery store in her house. She has many customers since she treats them very well. She has been a member of "Las Flores" (The Flowers) Community Bank for the past two years. She is always punctual with her payments. The first loan that she received was for 300 soles, money that she used to buy candy to sell. With this loan of 1500 soles, she will buy products for her store such as candy, drinks, noodles, sugar, etc. Germina's goal is to enlarge her grocery store (it is small). She also wants to sell gift items and to continue to work in order to provide her child with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy products for her kiosk such as noodles, sugar, candy and drinks

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania es una mujer muy activa  y emprendedora, tiene 32 años de edad, esta casada y tiene  2 hijos menores de edad, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él es albañil. Tania es una socia alegre que le gusta siempre colaborar en todo, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Audaces”, desde hace 7 años,  su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en golosinas. Con este préstamo de 1400 soles, ella invertirá en la compra de madera, listones y calaminas para arreglar su negocio y de esta manera dar buena imagen a su negocio. Su meta es comprarse una exhibidora para poner pasteles y algunos otros postre, también quisiera vender helados.
texts.en:
Tania is a very active and enterprising woman. She is 32 years old, is married and has 2 underage children. She has a small grocery store and has the support of her husband who is a mason. Tania is a very cheerful and active member of Communal Bank “Mujeres Audaces” which she has been a part of for 7 years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, that she used to buy candy. With the new loan of 1400 soles, she will use it to buy lumber, planks and bars to fix her business as it would give it a better appearance. Her goal is to buy a new display case to put cakes and other desserts, as well as to sell ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lumber, planks and bars to fix her business to give it a better appearance.

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es:
Sadith es una persona muy activa y colaboradora, tiene 51 años de edad, es madre de siete hijos, ella se dedica por las mañanas a la venta de jugos y por las tardes trabaja en una tienda  de decoraciones de ambientes, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es jubilado de educación y también la ayuda en la venta de jugos. Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Dulce Vida  II”, desde hace un año y es puntual en sus pagos. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de insumos para su negocio de venta de jugos. 
Con este crédito de S/ 1200 soles, Sadith invertirá en la compra de vasos, platitos, copas y en la compra de una vitrina para colocar sus tortas y panes. La meta de Sadiht es poner una fuente de soda en su casa ya que por donde vive no hay este tipo de servicio.
texts.en:
Sadith is a very active and collaborative person. She is 51 years old and the mother of 7 children. In the mornings, she sells juices and then manages her interior design store in the afternoons. She has the support of her husband, who is retired from the education field and also helps with selling juices.

She joined the Communal Bank “Dulce Vida II” (Sweet Life II) a year ago and has been punctual with her payments. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy supplies for her juice business.

With this loan of 1200 soles, Sadith will purchase glasses, saucers, cups, and a display case for storing cakes and breads. Her goal is to install a soda fountain in her home because no other place offers this type of service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase glasses, saucers, cups, and a display case for storing cakes and breads

loans.name: Rocío Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rocío del Pilar es una mujer trabajadora, alegre y muy dinámica, tiene 31 años, es  madre de 2 hijos  menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, pero solo para adultos, ofrece   su mercadería  en su casa, ya tiene una buena cartera de clientes que la visitan en su domicilio, esta mercadería la envían desde la ciudad de Lima. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él es mecánico en general. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Laboriosas II”, desde hace tres años. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en los gastos de su hogar y en la apertura de su negocio actual, compró ropa de segunda mano al por mayor. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual invertirá en traer ropa de segunda desde Lima. La meta de Rocío es poder tener una tienda de calzados y también dedicarse a la venta de joyas, de esta manera aportar en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Rocio del Pilar is a hardworking, cheerful, and dynamic woman. She is 31 years old and the mother of two children. Rocio sells used clothing, but only for adults. She offers her merchandise from her home and already has a long list of clients who visit her. The clothing is shipped in from the city of Lima. She has the support of her husband, who is a general mechanic by trade.

Rocio has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Laboriosas II” (The Industrious Ones II) for 3 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used for household expenses and starting her current business of selling secondhand clothing.

With this loan of 1000 soles, she will purchase more used clothing from Lima. Rocio’s goal is to open a shoe store and also sell jewelry so that she can have additional money for household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase secondhand clothing wholesale

loans.name: Mamou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamou S. est âgée de 34 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il vit en location avec plusieurs  co-locataires  dans le quartier Darsalam de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant fréquenté l’école coranique par la volonté de son père, très vite il l’abandonna pour l’exode en embrassant le métier de tailleur. Après 8 années apprentissage, et nanti de cette expérience, il évolue seul depuis 14 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation. Tailleur modéliste et styliste il est l’un des grands couturiers de la ville Ségou. Il a appris ce métier en république de Côte d’Ivoire dès  sa tendre enfance.
Pour équiper son atelier d’une nouvelle machine à coudre plus performante afin de s’adapter toujours à la mode,  il a  fait recours au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son 1er prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, une machine à coudre à Ségou. Monsieur   Mamou S. coud et vend ses habits à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Ses prestations et ventes se font généralement au comptant. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA, qui lui permettra de subvenir aux  charges familiales. 
Son ambition est d’agrandir son atelier et d’avoir une boutique de bazin.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamou S. is 34 years old, married, and the father of two children. He lives in a rented place with several co-tenants in the Darsalam district of the city of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having attended Koranic school per his father’s wishes, he soon quit and joined the exodus while embracing the trade of tailoring. After eight years of apprenticeship, and bestowed with this experience, he advanced on his own for fourteen years and now enjoys a strong reputation. A designer and a stylist, as well as a tailor, he is one of the great clothing makers in the city of Ségou. He learned this trade in the Republic of Cote d’Ivoire beginning in his early childhood. To equip his workshop with a new, more efficient sewing machine in order to adjust constantly to fashions, he turned to the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. He is on his first individual loan, which he intends to use to buy a sewing machine in Ségou. Mr. Mamou S. sews outfits and sells them to customers composed primarily of women. His services and sales are generally paid for in cash. He envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will enable him to provide for his family. His ambition is to expand his workshop and to have a store for damask fabrics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, tiene 43 años de edad y  es madre de cinco hijos, de los cuales 3 son mayores de edad y 2 menores aún. Ella  tiene una vulcanizadora (parche de llantas), lo apoya uno de sus hijos en este trabajo. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Águilas” desde hace  diez años, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él maneja su motokar. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, este dinero lo invirtió en la compra de golosinas, negocio que tenía y que piensa retomar.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 soles, ella comprará productos de primera necesidad (arroz,azúcar,fideos,leche ), ya que piensa poner una bodega en su casa. La meta de Guadalupe es tener una tienda de repuestos para motos y motocarros.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She is 43 years old and the mother of 5 children, of whom 3 are adults and 2 are still dependents. She offers vulcanization services (patching tires), which provides employment for one of her children.

Guadalupe has been a member of the Communal Bank "Las Águilas" (The Eagles) for 10 years. She has the support of her husband, who is a motorcar driver. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy candy for a business she managed and is thinking about restarting.

With this loan of 1500 soles, Guadalupe will buy basic necessity products (rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.) so that she can open a grocery store in her house. Her goal is to have another store selling parts for motorcycles and motorcars.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities in order to open a grocery store in her home
